Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: greeniz984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we got bumped from a flight and airline gave us free voucher. However, hotel charged me 35 bucks for a movie we never rented and was unable to provide me with any type of receipt or even a name of the movie. When I called to complain, I was told there is nothing they can do about it and to take it up with my credit card company. Front desk was clueless, don't add stress to your vacation, stay somewhere else. As I read through other reviews I am learning that they have charged other people for movies never watched. Coincidence? Or scam? What movie costs 35 dollars? I have no idea because they could not tell me. Poor excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Emerald E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in 2008 when it was still the Holiday Inn. I'm sure an actual "review" of the hotel and amenities isn't really relevant anymore (as it was so long ago) BUT I will say that I had a great stay at this hotel and would definitely go back, even now that they've changed to the Verdanza. The location was perfect. The beach was in close proximity. Approximately one block up. There were many eateries around in walking distance (including an Ihop for all my fellow pancake lovers!). I traveled with my best friend so we did a bit of partying at Drums and Club Brava (inside El San Juan Hotel & Casino) both were in walking distance. Safety was never a concern. We even took the local bus into Old San Juan. If you want to be close to everything, this is definitely a good option. And if they're anything like the Holiday Inn was the service and the rooms will meet or even exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MaritzaM1031
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! After my flight was cancel due to mechanical issues I got a voucher from my airline to stay overnight at verdanza, even know that I was there less than 24 hours the service was great the minute my husband and myself walk in they took care of us right away, I told them that I had a hand bag full of seafood which needed to be frozen right away and they made the arrangements inmediatly, everything was stored in the freezer at the kitchen and the next morning we pick it up and head to the airport. Thank You so much! Staff was excellent and very friendly, specially the guy from the coffee shop by the way great coffee! We had a room in front of the pool that was excellent, clean small but very cozy, best part Verdanza is a very short walk from the beach which we really enjoy. I am from P.R. And have to say Puerto Rico lo HACE MEJOR! I can wait to go back and I will be staying at Verdanza thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights in la isla del encanto”
Reviews.Author: Cody50
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay! Great staff, Best food in Puerto Rico!! @ the Bistro!!! Best Mojito! Will stay there again, the rooms are small but you have enough room to get around!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine V
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not what it seems. It has Water Bugs in the Hallways all Day and In the rooms There was water bugs, room service is horrible they make your bed but dont change ur sheets to clean ones. There Over rated. The rooms are very small and not nothing like the pictures. Food is very expensive and not good. I would never come here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Cricketcamp
Reviews.Content: helpful,efficient staff; wonderful dining venues on site; lovely pool and deck; check in and check out were smooth and easy; near beach; conveniently located near airport.

Reviews.Title: “Verdanza hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helayne V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden treasure. Everything is right at your finger tips. Dollar rent a car is in the lobby. The staff, management (especially Patricia the manager) were so accommodating and helpful. Food, cocktails,room service, bell hop, valet were the best. I will return and recommend this hotel to others. No more Hawaii for me. I have traveled to all the carribean islands and the verdanza made my stay most memorable. Thank you to the friendly staff. Helayne van houten San Diego ca

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary family trip”
Reviews.Author: Tom_in_Manty
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Verdanza was quite memorable. We were among many that had a cruise canceled at the last minute. The hotel and staff were very accommodating being fully booked. Our breakfasts every morning were amazing, a special thank you to our waitress with the dimples, sorry I can't remember her name. We spent the entire week of March 25th there and enjoyed our stay considering it was not our original vacation plan. I would reccommend the Verdanza to anyone planning a visit to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Verdanza”
Reviews.Author: artstung
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Verdanza more than made up for the rainy days last week in Puerto Rico. The hotel staff and the staff of the Dollar car rental were great - they made me feel right at home from the moment I entered the property. My third floor room had a private balcony, which was just what I wanted, so I could enjoy some fresh air - in between the rain! From the immigration officer to the bank clerk, to the staff at the Museo del Arte, my overall impression of the citizens of PR is their strong pride in their country, and their generous hospitality. I was very pleased with my Puerto Rico stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time/Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Arnaldo C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I went to report a non working iron at the front desk and by the time I returned to the room it had been changed. The pool was kept clean and the bars were great. You could also walk to a lot of stores and shops in Isla Verde and you were close to the highway and the airport. Hats off to the Verdanza..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shirley w
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel post cruise. Upon arrival the lobby was clean and the staff seemed nice. We registered and got a room over looking the pool, which by the way it took us 20 minutes to find this room and we had to drag our luggage up the stairs because the elevator did not run in the outside rooms over looking pool. When we got to the room after 20 mins. of looking our keys did not work and a housekeeper opened the door for us, we then went to the front desk and got new keys but it took 10 mins. every time we had returned to the room to open, so I guess it was a lock problem. The room was terrible, it was so humid in the room that our clothes in our luggage were wet. The tv had about 5 of the same channels that were on 10 stations...(the same channel's), the TV also was not watchable not only for poor channels but it had static lines constantly and the channels changed sometimes on it's own. We stayed two nights Feb 25th and 26th, 2012. Upon checking out to go to the airport I had prepaid my room with expedia and went to the front desk to give my keys and had to wait 30 minutes because there were people lined up to complain about there keys not working and tv problems. Finally it was my turn and the guy at the front desk gave me a receipt and wanted me to sign it. I looked it over which normally I don't but this had been such a nightmare I guess I felt something was up. The hotel charged us for a movie, named (IMMORTAL COMBAT), or something like that! I told the guy first off we did not watch tv because it had only about 5 channels 10 times each and the tv had so much static you could not view it, Secondly my husband is 57 and I am 43 we do not even know what that movie is and have never ordered a movie in our life. He told me he was not removing the charge and I told him I was not signing that paper with the charge. I asked for a manager and he went into the back and said I had to pay for it. I then asked for a manager to come up front and he said that I would have to wait because one she was not there yet. We moved aside and the very next person in line complained that her tv was changing channels itself and had bad static and her key did not work...(same problem's that we had). We waited for two hours and finally after three other customers were upset for us they said that they were not leaving until a manager came. I guess now I had a line of people that had problems and felt sorry that we were being done wrong. This rude clerk called the manager and spoke in Spanish which I do not speak, but anyways I am not sure what was said but finally they removed this charge. It only took 2 1/2 hours! We left that day and when we got to Omaha, NE I had a 104 degree temp. and had to be admitted to the hospital with a Viral Respitory Infection. I was told that because that room had been so humid and not very clean that a virus can spread easily in that enviroment. It took me 2 weeks to recover from this. I can't say for sure I got that virus from the hotel but I am almost 100% sure of it. I was shocked at how many people were in the lobby complaining the morning we checked out, so my advice to Anyone thinking of saving a few bucks by staying here please be advised it will cost you more in the long haul. There are so many other choices include vrbo condo's that you can stay in or other hotels, which by the way embassy suites was our pre cruise hotel and it was wonderful and not that much more. If you value your health, and your wallet along with your piece of mind of non complications DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “best value in isla verde”
Reviews.Author: boonan
Reviews.Content: this was our 3rd time visiting the verdanza hotel. the owners, and staff are the best. they always make you feel special. We are looking forward to our 4th visit in march 2013. the rest. are all very good. the location is very close to everyting. we would never stay anywere else!

Reviews.Title: “thanks”
Reviews.Author: jeff r
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night post-cruise and were very satisfied with the room and the service. staff was very accomodating and our room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: amber s
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were very clean and well maintained. Quick check in and check out! The poolside live music, food, and cocktail service is spectacular. Definitely try the mahi mahi wrap! The food and service at the 8020 restaurant was excellent for a great evening dinner as well. Also a plus is the hotelâ€™s location- itâ€™s very close to the San Juan International airport." The beach is just a block away!

Reviews.Title: “not bad...”
Reviews.Author: Jen61C
Reviews.Content: I was put up here for one night after being bumped off my Delta flight. Front desk people helpful upon check-in...even provided me a toothbrush and toothpaste as all I had with me was my carry on!! Thought that was very nice. Room on the 8th floor was small but seemed fine...comfy beds but tiny bathroom. Balcony overlooking the pool was quite small and kind of dirty; only big enough to stand on...nice view of ocean beyond and between some tall condos. Ate at the bar in the lobby...had credit from airline for food but unable to order full dinner menu because the cook wasn't on duty yet so just could order appetizers, left with credit still available but what I did get to order was tasty. There was a Walgreens 2 blocks away and seemed to be a lot of other places around although I didn't much of a chance to explore. All in all this wasn't a bad place...seems like a good choice if you want to be close to the airport and in the middle of it all.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby. Good location. Room poor.”
Reviews.Author: CandCTx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying out based upon reviews here. Check-in was long due to a cancelled flight & bumped passengers, so not the staffs fault. We checked in at 2P & room wasn't ready until 430P. While 3 is the stated time, what hotel really waits until 3 these days anyway. But ok. Enjoyed the pool while waiting. Nice area with DJ playing island tunes. Our room was in the two-story tower. Room is why I won't stay here again. Dingy, musty & just felt everything was somehow dirty. Nice furniture, but the noticeable rust in the bathroom, dirty carpet, noisy (ringing sound) tv, door lacking weather stripping (could see sunlight on sides & bottom) and nightime loud sounds from the Pizza Hut outside entry door is reason for my poor rating. Positive note - maintenance was quickly responsive to request to fix an issue. And staff encountered were all friendly. But I like a nice room to come to at night, and I don't want to return to this room again - ever. My Hilton & Starwood Gold and IHG Platinum status doesn't get me far here with my complaints, so next layover I'll stick with those three chains and avoid this room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: Enriquegb
Reviews.Content: Fitness center is small but machines are new and it has a great view of the ocean. Bussiness center is one very old computer with faulty mouse. Lots of restaurants and the coffee shop in site was outstanding. Rooms are old but clean. Beds are comfortable enough and the room although at ground level was very quiet. There is no plug to connect your computer at the cramped desk so you end with it on your lap. Wifi works great. Location is good for bussiness, quick to the airport and major highways. Bathroom is not pretty but again clean. Hot water takes a while. A/C works fine and T.V. does too. Would not go there on vacation, pool has a terrible view but, you guessed it, it is very clean. For bussiness I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean's Most Friendly Island”
Reviews.Author: CARBOMAINMAN
Reviews.Content: From the moment we set foot on the island up until we left, hotel staff & every local person was warm, friendly & helpful on places to eat, drink & see. The food & hospitality was wonderful. I just wish littering was much more inforced & everyone was more considerate of the environment. In all a fantastic vacation

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff & pool”
Reviews.Author: cy0079
Reviews.Content: During a family vacation we only stayed one night but wished we could have stayed longer. Staff was extremely helpful and we were given flavored ice treats for the kids (limbes in Spanish) and vouchers for pina coladas for the adults. The kids enjoyed the pool and the large chess set until the last minute.There were Various choices for a quick bite or a sit down dinner. Rooms were clean and unlike other reviews there was no mold in our rooms. Needless to say we were very happy with our stay here..would & will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I could have stayed at the holiday inn!”
Reviews.Author: topaz1100
Reviews.Content: For what we paid it was not as expected. It was ok for 1 night. The location left a lot to be desired. I will not stay here again. We checked in very late and preferred to leave early to wait at the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excelent service.”
Reviews.Author: Maelo76
Reviews.Content: I like it very much. Great customer service. Clean and confy rooms. Free Wifi and great location. Near everything in Isla Verde. I definitely staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Weeding Night”
Reviews.Author: Yamil R
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience for us. All was great the service, the attentions and the rooms were beautiful we enjoy a lot doing our weeding in this hotel. I would like to stay more days and with less stress, just to enjoy my vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline r
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The employs were very friendly, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. I would not recommend the pancakes for breakfast, not only were they $12 in which they add another $4 room service, I actually paid $19 for pancakes that were like cardboard no matter how much syrup I put on them they were horrible. I mentioned it to the manager on my check out and she was so kind to cancel the charges. I would stay at the Verdanza again. I really enjoyed my time there!

Reviews.Title: “December in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahS
Reviews.Content: We decided to go on a last minute trip to San Juan because Seattle was beginning to get a little cold, wet and unbearable. We made reservations at the Verdanza and to our surprise we were upgraded to a beautiful suite upon checkin. Although our stay was pretty short (3 nights), we had a wonderful time and the friendliness and service from the staff was outstanding. Verdanza is on the other side of the Carolina strip (away from the beach), but we got plenty of much needed sun by the Verdanza pool which was clean, impeccably kept and featured gorgeous orchids that were expertly grafted on to the well-manicured palms. Overall a great experience, and we're already looking forward to our return visit. :)

Reviews.Title: “Was Just There and going Back in April!”
Reviews.Author: Spackenkill
Reviews.Content: Me and my Girlfriend were just at the Verdanza last week. The place is nice,clean and has everything you need. The Wine bar is excellent!! The service is great. The room I stayed in could definately of used some remodelling but served the purpose, it was on the 3rd floor. The location of this hotel is great, close to everything. We loved it so much that we are going back on April 1 for 5 days again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Jason K
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old daughter, and I stayed at the Verdanza in February while visiting Puerto Rico for my brother-in-law's wedding. The hotel is very beautiful and modern. There are several restaurants in the hotel that are very nice also. We were set to arrive just a few days after Valentine's Day, so instead of buying flowers for my wife at home (they would have died while we were away) I contacted the hotel via their website to inquire about getting flowers in the room for my wife upon arrival. The response to my inquiry was very fast (within a couple hours) and correspondence was constant. I was able to get a beautiful rose boquet for my wife for just under $70 USD (FTD would have been the same at home in WI). The flowers were in the room when we arrived and they were simply amazing, and they were still beautiful the day we left a week later. The Verdanza also took the liberty of sending what they called "a small plate of chocolate covered strawberries" to the room. The strawberries were complimentary. This was no small plate! It was huge and it featured a box made entirely of chocolate with chocolate covered strawberries and blackberries as well as whipped cream. The presentation was so awesome and it was certainly more than a "small plate". This went far beyond my expecataions, in fact, I was completely blown away. We had a wonderful stay, the hotel is very close to local restaurants, 24 hour grocery store, and the airport. We did not hear planes in our room at all during the stay. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we ever come back to Puerto Rico. THANK YOU Verdanza!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kgilbert_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Verdanza for 3 days prior to a cruise. It was beautifully landscaped, quiet and our room was around the pool. We had a small refridgerator and the supermarket was just around the corner so we could get small items for our comfort easily.The staff at the restaurants, front desk, and the lunch counter were great - very professional and polite. We enjoyed walking both day and evening around the area, and to the beach. The Metropol restaurant was a good suggestion from the front desk. We enjoyed walking to the casinos in the area. We took a taxi to the cruise ship and had time to walk around Old San Juan which is always wonderful. Even after our cruise, they allowed us to stow our bags while waiting for our flight. I will definitely return - to this relaxing and lovely accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Verdanza hotel 2 years later”
Reviews.Author: littlemacwinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I have read some review about this hotel that were not very positive. We were there Feb/12 and found the room and service excellent. They are re doing some of the older rooms, new carpet etc. We had a pool side room and it was older but clean and very comfortable. The pool is great, good food several restaurants and a good location. We would definetly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a lovely place to stay, right next to the airport”
Reviews.Author: DavePorter090
Reviews.Content: Came in late on a Sunday night following a flight delay. Missed our connecting flight. Asked a local friend for a recommendation, and took the five-minute cab ride to the Verdanza. Professional and prompt service at the desk, a clean and comfortable room. Terrific dinner with attentive staff at J.H.Yee's restaurant on the main floor. Quiet place, with a deli on the lobby floor. Very nice patio with very decent-sized swimming pool with good landscaping (and lots of coqui frogs in the bushes). Large and sociable hot tub. It's the kind of place where you won't be surprised to see the local television personalities on their own dime. Breakfast buffet comes with the price of the room - very well staffed and laid out with good quality food. Lobby staff was attentive and professional on the way out. I was sorry we had to leave so early to make our connecting flight, and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: granny3girls
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Canda, hot and tired and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helped us get through the registration preocess with ease and offered us a frozen treat as we were so warm. They were helpful and answered all our questions, such as where to find the taxis etc.,and told us here we could find the rest of our group as we came in a large group. We got hotel vouchers and a drink coupon. (great) Our room was a large room with comfortable beds and a huge bathroom (very clean). They even had an enlarged mirrow for us blind !!! ladies to see in. Pool was beautiful although we did not have much time there. Restaurants in the hotel clean and food good. The beach was a few minutes walk but the view was superb. Drove to old San Juan for dinner and evening entertainment and was suprised to see how many people walked the streets at night. All in all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Harry2837
Reviews.Content: Great place. Nice little wine bar beside the lobby, close to the airport (but you donâ€™t hear the planes), friendly staff and a big hot tub. For me this is a better choice than the El San Juan which is big, brash, and pricy. The Verdanza is slightly off the main drag and has a more chilled out feel. Be aware that the beach is a couple of minutesâ€™ walk away. Food is good here but things close a tad early. There are plenty of dining options nearby and it is also close to the bus to Old San Juan. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, laid back choice”
Reviews.Author: DKtraveller15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Verdanza for a long weekend in Feb 2012 and our overall impression was very positive. We had a room on the 8th floor, where there is a gym and a roof deck with excellent views of San Juan and the mountains beyond. The hotel is a block from the beach, but the sea was clearly visible from our small balcony. Our bathroom was small but everything was clean. The bed was large and comfortable. The best thing abut the hotel was the pool and hot tub. It is possible to walk to the beach in five minutes, but as the beach was pretty windy, we elected to stay in the more sheltered pool area. Both the pool and the hot tub are a good size and the spray park was kind of fun too. I like the fact that they allow you to hang out in the hot tub at night. The food was excellent. A special mention goes to the Risretto coffee bar, which has fantastic coffee, and the Di Vino wine bar. Owner Dario is a real character and has a fantastic knowledge of wine. The Asian bistro is also good. We didnâ€™t have a bad meal at the hotel.. There were a couple of negatives. Remember that things take longer here, not least the water in the hotel room which on the 8th floor took about 10 minutes to become hot. Also, the elevators were a little old and tired and could do with an update. Overall, this was an excellent choice for the price. We checked out the El San Juan and the InterContinental across the street, but were glad we opted for the more laid back atmosphere of the Verdanza.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Angel H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with a fabulous view of the city and the ocean from the top floor. It's not ocean front but only about a block from the ocean - a fantastic value. Clean rooms, lovely pool and friendly staff. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: JFRP
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 4 nights at the Verdanza Hotel in Isla Verde. Close to great beach and very close to International airport. Rooms were comfortable, good size and clean. Bathrooms are small. Lobby and public areas were always very clean and nicely furnished. The staff is very friendly - including Front Desk & housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mary52181
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in! There was a horrible stench of mildews and mold. The more I looked around the more black mold I found. I could deal with a small room or old tv. But the amount of mold was disgusting. This hotel would be shut down if it was located in the states. I slept with the lights on, in pants and long sleeves as I was so grossed out. Only stayed one night thank goodness. If we had gotten in earlier in the evening I would have looked for a new hotel. I am posting pictures of the mold. Please do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “SO CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: PAULWOODS1
Reviews.Content: Given the sort of headline "Do Not Stay Here" it is a wonder that I did. I am glad that I did and can recommend this establishment to anyone who want reasonably priced accommodation in an excellent location. The hotel is so close to the airport that the taxi price is very modest and it takes no more than 5-7 minutes from arrivals. This used to be a Holiday Inn and is still recovering from neglect over some period of time. I was assigned a room quickly and this was of a fair size - not enormous but then I am alone and need to sleep, bathe, and change. I do not need vast areas to cross. I thought that the position of the bed under the air conditioner was odd as cold air would be dropping all night so I turned it off and it was fine. Likewise the clock was plugged into a well unit which meant that there was a wire stretched across the wall. It was not dangerous but it just seemed odd. The front desk were charming - they offered my a fruit cup on both arrivals (I stayed twice during my trip) and did all they could if I had any queries. I had one problem in the main restaurant and this was dealt with by the manager (a kitchen problem) in a proper and honest fashion.. One could eat outside by the pool which was pleasant as I found that the air conditioning was so high indoors that it was chilly enough to need a sweater!). The great find was the Asian restaurant. The food was delicious and very well priced, beautifully cooked and the portions were generous. Moreover it does not shut at some ridiculously early hour as do so many places. I ate here several times including Christmas Eve after mass. We were seated at 10.15 and there was no fuss, no bother, no looking at watches. nor worse starting to clean the place before the guests have finished. It is most unpleasant trying to have a conversation with a vacuum cleaner running amok! There is also a rather good bar with excellent friendly staff and there is also a rather chic (especially for Puerto Rico) wine bar. One can drink and eat there or outside should one prefer.I do wish that they would sort out the parking though as I really feel that parking should be offered to one's guest - but that is just my thought. Although my room was on the "airport side" I was not bothered by aircraft noise and I slept extremely well. The swimming pool is delightful as were a group of young men who seemed to be part of a swimming team. Ons of them managed to break the cover to to the filter controls. This cover flew into the pool leaving a hole which could have caused someone injury had someone walked by the pool and not noticed this. This was treated with complete indifference by the person who had caused this and whilst this was an accident - no one (except me) bothered reporting this. It was dealt with promptly and efficiently. Clearly this hotel has a few issues that it has inherited but they are being addressed and I repeat that this hotel is very pleasant, has good facilities and is only a short walk from the beach. All in all you can stay here with confidence. They read these remarks and take them to heart. I found no mould, no

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kts70281
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Verdanza Hotel. This hotel is not far from the main airport there in San Juan. It has a beautiful pool area and several restaurant choices. We did eat in the one restaurant which was the bar/grill one. I just had the conch salad which was great. The restaurants are a little pricey but not bad. We were there on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The lobby area is huge and very nice with comfortable seating areas. Outside of the lobby is a nice garden seating area or you can go back by the pool and relax out there. The landscaping is nice with some beautiful flowers. The room I stayed in was really clean. There were no problems. Sometimes I hear people complain of must or mold smells...well, that is what happens most everywhere in the tropics...my room had no mold or must issues at all! My 15 year old daughter stayed with me here and we loved it. There is the Pueblo Supermarket within walking distance if you need groceries, plenty of restaurants, stores, and the beach....all within a couple of blocks. The beds were very comfortable as well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Rbencomo
Reviews.Content: I travel often for work and I have never stayed in a hotel as bad as this. Rooms are incredibly small, there was mold in the closet, it took over 2 hours to get a remote control for the TV, as I am writing this I have been waiting almost an hour for someone to come to my room and see why there is NO HOT WATER IN THE SHOWER!!!! I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for what it is!”
Reviews.Author: eclipsethecat
Reviews.Content: The Verdanza Hotel is a beautiful hotel in the lobby. It is so so in the rest of the area but certainly not filthy. I think the best way I can describe it is that Puerto Rico is humid so it is kind of like a summer cabin- when you open it up for the year it might smell musty and have a couple issues with water damage but certainly not anything that would prevent me from going there again. The Verdanza is a short ride from the airport (I think the taxi cost $15 with luggage?) and check in was a breeze (we booked through Orbitz.) When we got the room there was a mini fridge and a nice tv which was nice to watch the sports we were missing out on because we were away from home. They had all the major channels. We walked down to the lobby for dinner the first night because we were tired and had a nice dinner- you can see our review on that on Tripadvisor as well. We rented a car through the car rental place but only after we rented it online- we saved $30 doing this- the â€œspecial hotel offerâ€� the guy offered us was $65 for a day for the regular size car- we went online through my phone in the hotel room and booked it online for $35 a day. We chose to fill it up with gas on our own and saved money that way- the guy said it would be cheaper to fill up with him but it was cheaper for us to fill up ourselves. We drove out to El Yunque and to the Bacardi distillery and had a nice day for not very much money- I certainly wouldnâ€™t pay for a tour to do these things as driving is not complicated- just one word of caution, your GPS may or may not work- both of our GPSâ€™s did not work so we wished we had printed directions from the Rainforest to the Bacardi Factory because we got lost and my Spanish is not as good as I remembered. ï�Š Anyways, back to the hotel. The toilet clogged the first day and by the time we got back from our adventure it was fixed. There was no water in our fridge (it said two free waters,) but this was quickly fixed. The coconut ice that is given to you upon check in is a nice touch! The hotel is within walking distance from a CVS and a Wendys- we went there the second night and had a â€œcheap dinnerâ€� (the price was comparable to the US,) and then walked back to the hotel to eat in bed. The water pressure in the showers left a little to be desired and the water didnâ€™t get very hot but overall we thought it was a nice place to stay and provided us with what we needed. We felt very safe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad”
Reviews.Author: d g
Reviews.Content: Check in was a disaster--no help from the desk, which was understaffed. Sat by the pool for hours waiting for a room. Pool is great. Location is good. Walk to everything although not directly on the beach. Restaurants are convenient-yet overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel small rooms”
Reviews.Author: busdriver159
Reviews.Content: The is a good hotel. Beware that the rooms are quite small. The hotel is clean overall but there are small things that are not up to par. I would definately stay there again. The pool was great and would be great for small children. The restaurants at the hotel are quite expensive but there are many good restaurants in the area. The area seem safe and we even rode the public bus to Old San Juan and it felt safe. There is a Dollar Car Rental in the lobby but book online as it is cheaper. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “really touch and go.”
Reviews.Author: reivilo
Reviews.Content: The bad: The restaurants in the hotel are over priced trash with horrible service. the air condition went out in our room. you have to pay for parking (15.00/day). the good: comfy beds. there was a dj in the lobby on Saturday night (it was a special event). very close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Damp smell let's hotel down”
Reviews.Author: D0nLucifer
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel until I got to my room. Checkin staff were really good and staff in restaurants excellent. The room I had was a different story. I stayed in a pool side room and when I entered my room was greeted with a very pungent smell which at first did not know what it was. I arrived very late at night and had been travelling from Ireland so just wanted to sleep. I keep waking up to the smell which I can only describe as a very strong damp smell. I reported this to reception but they were unable to give me another room. The smell was almost unbearable and led to giving me constant headaches. I tried to spend as little time in the room as possible which is not ideal when you are away on business and need to work or just relax after a long day. I stayed here fir 5 nights and reported the smell again when I checked out. The staff are very aware of this and it seems to be a common complaint. Despite the great service in the hotel, I value my sleep more and don't need to be getting headaches. I spend a lot of time in puerto rico on business but unfortunately will not be staying at this hotel again and wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Jewel, right in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Katanapilot
Reviews.Content: So a quick flight from the East Coast, no passport, no customs, and a tropical island make Puerto Rico a wonderful vacation destination. I must say I did not want to expect anything, and to be hones I was ready to be disappointed. Well the Verdanza hotel and it's staff were just AMAZING! You might think, this place is not on the water... trust me when I say it is Close enough that it does not need to be. The hotel staff were well trained and very polite, the rooms were clean and the giant bed cured my back pains. They have 3 restaurants on the property and even if that was not enough for you. They are located on the main strip where there are countless restaurants in Isla Verde. The night life in their bar was full on party, the pool deck was being enjoyed by family members, the kids loved the water features. Every time I walked out my room I seen someone painting or cleaning something. I can not stress enough if you want an affordable, clean, safe place to stay in Isla Verde, come visit the Verdanza Hotel. They are great people that will guide tourist alike to the "must see spots" of the Island. again...please visit the Verdanza!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality, close to beach, good amenities.”
Reviews.Author: darrah2176
Reviews.Content: Hotel employees went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Delicious restaurants with good variety of food. Nice pool and hot tub, but I wish the water park had been guest-operated rather than on a timer.

Reviews.Title: “Almost”
Reviews.Author: Eastward
Reviews.Content: I so want to say this is a great place to stay, but it just hasn't been for me. First, the room: a plug in air freshener does little to cover up the smokey smell, and just made my head clog up. I unplugged it and put it outside. The carpet is stained and off putting. The furniture is battered. The door latches don't work to lock the doors. But other than that ... after missing a day of housekeeping I called for extra coffee (thank you, after I called several times) and today my room was sparkling clean (except for the carpet) and the door to the lanai was locked. However, the bed is comfy, there's a little frig, coffee maker, the bathroom is fine, haven't tried the TV. The lanai looks out over the pool, which is appealing, and the kids play ground has the most amazing water feature! Almost .... OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Carolina, Puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: rmamani
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel by all measures, great value, excellent service and great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 01_klynn_21
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just returned from spending 5 nights at this hotel. The lobby and the pool area was exactly as the pictures had shown. We knew we had not paid for the top of the line room so we were not expecting a flat screen tv but we were expecting a bigger room. Our room had 2 beds but we were in tight quarters. Bath tub did not work so my 6 year old was reduced to taking showers. Not a big deal. There were only 3 bath towels and 2 wash clothes. Housekeeping did provide more bath towels but could not seem to get more wash clothes. Room had a refrigerator which was a bonus for us. Room was also very quiet. Pool was great. Very clean. Hot tub was clean and hot. Staff was very friendly. Great proximity to the ocean. Easy 2 block walk. Also great location for catching public bus to Old San Juan. Bus is a great deal @ 75 cents. On check out day, house keeping knocked on door @ 7:30 and asked when we were checking out. Told her not until noon. Never heard from her again. Overall, the hotel was adequate for a place to rest each night. If you are looking for a luxury resort this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “trip to the dump”
Reviews.Author: Penny G
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be a ZERO no way is it 3 1/2 stars. There was no flat screen television as shown in the pictures. Carpet was stained everywhere. Shower head hanging from the wall, light on balcony hanging out by the wires. TERRIBLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: William P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 wonderful days in San Juan. We lucked out on selecting a hotel. The Verdanza Hotel was great in all ways. Has four very good restaurants and each one specializes in something diffrent. The Asian restaurant and the wine bar are superb. Rooms were very nice and very clean. Pool area is well manicured and very relaxing. Best of all was the service of the employees and their extremely outgoing and helpfulness. A wonderful beach is only a block away. Same beach used by guests of expensive hotels. Old San Juan is a must-see and is only about 10 minutes by cab from the hotel. Cab drivers are also very nice and cabs were large and well maintained. All in all, it was a great trip and we have recommended San Juan and the Verdanza Hotel to all our friends and coworkers. Pennpal45

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give them a ZERO! 3 1/2 stars?! You're KIDDING me!!”
Reviews.Author: IFLYHIGH89
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to crash for a night before a cruise. If I could post every pic I took of their crappy hotel, I would. Mold infested, rust infested, FILTHY carpet, FILTHY property (THERE WERE STRAY CATS FEEDING BEHIND THE HOTEL IN WHAT LOOKED LIKE SOME KIND OF OPEN SEWER LINE) Who the heck is giving good reviews, employers?? Family members?? VERY UNSATISFIED!

Reviews.Title: “Price was right, property was good, service was good and bad.”
Reviews.Author: Atlasheld
Reviews.Content: Not a bad looking hotel, and certainly a good price. As an afterthought we decided to look around for a hotel in Isla Verde and though every hotel was sold out this one wasn't. So, the hotel property itself has the makings of a decent place and is moderately on the high end of a midlevel hotel (or low end of a high end hotel). Lobby was nice, and the room was surprisingly well apportioned and decorated. Nice bathroom, work table with internet with a couple of full size bottles of fiji water on the house, big comfortable bed, and a nice flat panel tv. We didn't see the pool area so I can't comment. The gym was ok, generally what you would expect of a hotel- nothing spectacular (though I would STRONGLY avoid staying on the floor that houses the gym since the potent smell of gym people's hard work was very prevalent everywhere). The restaurant we went to (one of three they have on property) , adjacent to the pool (eighty20 bistro) was ok. Food was alright, service was a bit lacking but overall it was fine. Service- the BIG miss, the one that cost this place two stars, and made us leave. So, there we are after a long, active, and wonderful two weeks (two nights left to go) trip through the island, having just gotten back from Culebra (definitely suggest a trip there) we wait to check in. There was someone in front of us, one person, and well, we continue to wait, and wait. 25 minutes in total (now, even island time and pace was offended by this length. We, however, didn't care all that much, so I only mention it for your information). We check in, getting the complimentary coconut ice-cream (a VERY NICE TOUCH). We had previously been staying at the double tree by Hilton (which we LOVED) but decided to change it up. When we checked in we told them we were booking for one night, but would likely stay two, asked for and were granted a late check out so we could decide and went up to our room for the night. Ah, the joy of sleeping after a long trip. We doing just that when at 7:30 a.m. we get a loud and urgent knocking on the door. uh, ok. It was housekeeping. I did not want to be answering the door for housekeeping...at 7:30 am. "we are still sleeping" I yawned and was left in peace. Kind of annoying but ok, it's done right? Wrong. Half an hour later... knocking. Every hour (and with this, I am deadly serious) until at 12 the supervisor comes a knocking to give us the business because the maid had to clean up and rudely stated that we needed to get going. WTfing hockey sticks?? I had previously explained to the maid that we were staying another night and didn't want our room cleaned. Guessing that message didn't get through. So, at that, I had had enough and let the supervisor have the business, that it was obscene to come calling that early, and I wouldn't even expect that from a freaking motel eight. That we had intended to stay but because of this were not and that I had full intention of complaining, all the while in a big way writing her name down in dramatic fashion on a piece of paper to illustrate how things were working out (checking in at 11:30 pm heading to bed at around 1 I was all bluster and peacock feathers). And I did just that. Complained. The very sweet and professional front desk agent was, rightfully, mortified (as well as very confused) when I explained what had happened and that we were leaving for greener pastures. She immediately offered to buy us breakfast (we obliged) and asked what she could do to keep us. "take money off either this night or the next". She, apparently, was unable to do either. She said she would speak immediately to her manager, and I suggested someone tell the housekeeping staff that that was simply unacceptable. And with that...we went back to the hotel we love! Moral of the story, there is a reason this place looks this good and only comes in at a tad over a hundred per night. I'd avoid unless you are stuck (or need to get up early).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shivon7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually nice. The restaurant and bar food was great. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly to us tourist. Just beware of the $75/night holding fee (refundable upon checkout) they will process on your card at check in and the additional fees you will incure during check out. They do not disclose that.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin??”
Reviews.Author: Destiny11
Reviews.Content: Alright, well I travel often and I'm all for reading reviews to determine whether or not a place is worth staying at, or even visiting. Now I planned a birthday getaway for my mother. I had bought a getaway package in which I chose El San Juan Resort and Casino but due to the hurricane and loss of electricity I was called by my travel agent and given the option to change dates to stay at the same resort or change resort/hotel. I was unable to change the dates so I decided to just pick another hotel. Before choosing Verdanza I checked the reviews. I seen some great reviews and a few bad ones. Now theres always those unsatisfied people that you can bend backwards for and yet something is still not right. So I overlooked the bad reviews and went based on the good reviews plus how the pics of the hotel are clearly beautiful. The location is great!! So we arrived at the hotel, the lady at the front desk was very nice allowed us to check in early. Once we passed the beautiful main lobby and restaurant and entered the elevator we noticed a horrible odor of mold...yes mold. The previous reviews of mold is most def true. Theres no way that smell can go unnoticed. We stayed on the fifth floor. Walking down the hall the smell remained. I thought ugh maybe it's because of the rain from the hurricane...let me give this place the benefit of the doubt. Our room was beautiful. The furniture in our room was fairly new. The bathroom was very small. The shower force was absolutely horrible. The sad part was that the room had a slight odd odor. In which we woke up congested every morning. We ate Coladas...The waiter was very nice, food was amazing!! We rented a car from Dollar Car Rental which is based out of Verdanza hotel. Well the rental was last minute but as we got the keys no one told us we had to pay parking. I didnt realize til days later when they kept asking me my room number and I finally ask for what. I assumed because I was staying at that hotel I would have free parking. Nonetheless no one informed me previously which I thought was deceptive. When I spoke to management about it, his response was "Its posted on our website". In which I explained how I didn't look at their website because 1) I wasn't suppose to stay here and 2) I didn't intend on renting a car. Anyway that was a lost cause, and management didnt seem to care that I the customer felt deceived. Ok! So that morning I told management I did not want housekeeping in my room and that if I needed something I would come ask for it. He said okay. Sure enough, later that afternoon when we got back out beds were made. Someone clearly came into my room. When I called to complain the managements response was "Did you leave a do not disturb sign on the door?" Hello...I told the manager directly that wasn't good enough. He said he would speak to housekeeping's supervisor. Either way my rights as a customer at the hotel was clearly violated. Housekeeping didnt even have any fault because most likely the manager didnt relay the message. Great management!! Some of the employees were very nice while others such as that specific manager, were rude individuals. And thats an understatement. Also, we had the buffet included in our stay every morning. Well our first morning, I get a bill for 30.00 I told the lady It was included in my stay but she had no clue. Now if I would not have paid attention and signed the bill...without realizing it was adding up on a tab to my room to be charged to my card before I leave I would have paid 30 a day for breakfast for two. I stormed to the front desk and got it all settled. But I should not have had to. Overall, the hotel looks beautiful and the location is great but it is def not worth it. There are several hotels in the Isla Verde strip. El San Juan looks beautiful and Its a block away. I was astonished of how elegant they make the place out to seem but yet the service is really horrible, people are rude, and theres a horrible smell of mold. Our shower ceiling had a little bit of mold. I think a lot of work would have to be done to get rid of the smell. And to think they clean that place every day all day long. I think its to hide the smell. I noticed it smells stronger before they began cleaning than after. Good luck!! Hope someone finds this review helpful and actually trust me :) p.S I didnt run into roaches or any bugs at that but I wouldnt put anything past the Verdanza Hotel. Oh yeah the beds are comfortable but at this point I dont even think it matters!

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jewanna c
Reviews.Content: Friend and I thought the hotel was very cute. Nice furnishings, great staff and we loved the location in Isle Verde. The room was slightly musty, but we've experienced that in just about every island hotel we've visited so we weren't bothered. Our first night there, the manager had some type of happy hour with free food and free drinks! We also had a problem with our fridge door being open. When the attendant came to fix it and couldn't, we got a new fridge, all of this start to finish was about 20 minutes. Our only complaint happened at checkout with a surprise phone bill. We were charged $10 for a 2 minute local call. They didn't have rates posted anywhere so we figured there was no charge for local calls. When we returned home I wrote management, and was relieved that we were issued a refund and they planned to somehow find a way to notify guests of the phone charges. All in all, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “extremely disapointed”
Reviews.Author: lcgood69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a cruise in 2008 that departed from San Juan and decided to stay in Isla Verde for 2 days and came across this hotel. At the time it was a Holiday Inn and we decided to stay here because we enjoyed our other vacations at Holiday Inn's and the pictures looked decent for a 2 night stay before leaving on our cruise. Well we weren't disappointed and had a wonderful time, the hotel was clean the pool crystal clear and the staff very knowledgable about the island and very attentive and extremely polite. We even saw a couple celebrating an anniversay in their catering rooms. We were so happy with our stay that we decided the next time we vacationed in Puerto Rico this would be our place to stay. Fast forward to 2011 we were going to vacation in Puerto Rico in July, this time taking our 15 year old son with us. We decided what better place to stay. I couldn't find it online using the Holiday Inn website and decided to call, it was then I found that it was no longer owned by them and now being called hotel Verdanza. I was a little skeptical at first but went on their website, they seemed ok and the price was right and booked a 5 day stay at the hotel. Well my title tells it all. From the moment we walked in I was able to tell the difference. The Lobby was ok and clean, but the atmosphere was different the staff was not as attentive and knowledgable as they were the last time we visited. The room seemed as if it hadn't been updated since the last time we were there, you would think if they purchased the hotel from someone they would make some type of renovation and you could tell none were made. They just purchased the hotel and kept it business as usual. The lamp shade had rust, maybe from a leak from somewhere it smelled a little musty and the bathroom was no better. There were rust stains and the shower smelled as if they had a mold problem in the past. My husband and I also complained about the water pressure which wasn't the greatest and the concierge's response when asked what would happen if they could not fix the pressure was "Well we will try and fix it and if we can't then we'll discuss what COULD be done". Not reassuring in the least, but that wasn't even the tip of the iceberg, the worst part of the stay was the pool, when I went to the back I noticed the water was a little cloudy, I mentioned something to my husband and he asked that we try to make the best of our vacation, he mentioned it could have been because they're were so many people staying at the hotel that weekend, it was due to the amount of lotions and body oil's people were putting on, and that they have to pass inspections so it couldn't be as bad as I was imagining it was. While swimming I kept seeing strands of hair floating in the water, grossed me out, but it was July in Puerto Rico and I was hot, I figured I would just cool off and not try to think about it too much. Well 3 days later my son starts to cough and complain about a sore throat, I give him some aspirin and kept him hydrated so he would be able to kick whatever bug was trying to make him sick. Then the following day my throat starts hurting and to top it off I feel a tinglig on my lip and I get a fever blister, needless to say I was glad to leave there when my stay was over, as soon as we got home, my husband gets sick with fever and sore throat, we all ended up going to the Dr, especially when my fever blister for some reason would not heal and it was now spreading to my bottom lip. Well when we get to the Dr he puts us all on anti-biotics and tells us we all had a virus that could have been caused by the dirty water they had in the pool. I didn't complain to the hotel, because I don't ever want to stay in that hotel ever again, not even if they offered me a free stay. I would rather pay an extra 100.00 a night and stay in the El San Juan Hotel before ever staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: APKApopka_Fl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take this trip to San Juan for a weekend getaway. The location was perfect to everything around the hotel. Check in was quick and the front desk clerk was very polite and helpful. They also gave a us a welcome dessert (frozen coconut). That was nice. We got into the room only complaint was that the room was outdated. The desk was falling apart. Bathroom was tiny and in a funny shaped angle. The bed was nice. We had a great view of the pool. Was quiet too. We had to cut our trip early due to Hurricane Irene. The bellman Miguel was cool. He had a lot of Information to share about the area. Would def' go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse then the last time”
Reviews.Author: Al S
Reviews.Content: This hotal has gone from a bad Holiday Inn to an extremly bad independent hotel. They did paint the building, bbut inside it is worse. I had problems using AOL, at first the hotel and internet provider blamed AOL, for not being able to connect. When I was able to connect at the wine bar, then the hotel blamed the provider and assured be the problem would be fixed the next day, 3 days later and nothing was done. The bed side lamp did not work, the shower curtin rod was falling off the wall. and then I woke up one moring to find a roach, in the bed with me. Puerto Rico is a fantastic place to visit, just do yourself a BIG favor do not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Puertorista
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Verdanza for a short family vacation. Every staff member was pleasant. The room was outdated, the structure needs some repairs. The ceilings have water stains and my bathroom door didnt close. The A/C was extremely noisy but I have to admit that once you are tired not even the A/C can wake you up. We stayed in one of the first floor rooms in front of the pool. I thought it was going to be a problem being so close to the pool but you can not hear the noise once you close your door. The housekeeping is good. They do a pretty good job everyday. We ordered room service, it was expensive but the food was delicious. The "arroz mamposteao" had a lot of flavor. If you plan to visit the pool make sure to get your towels early. We tried to get towels (that you have to pick up at the front desk) at about 2pm and they had none. I told them to call me once they had any clean towels but that call never came, so sad 'cause I had very high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel & Excellent for conventions!”
Reviews.Author: STXGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I attend an annual convention in PR, and this year it was held at Verdanza, July 29-31, 2011. The hotel was gorgeous, the staff was friendly and attentive, the place was clean (and thoroughly cleaned every day) and we had a great time! I personally enjoyed the deep tubs and limitless hot water- I took a long bath every night which really added to the relaxation factor - as did the incredible beds!!! SOOOO comfortable!! For our convention event, we were treated so well- the staff really went out of their way to accommodate us and make us feel like VIPS! Each day I noticed amenities I had overlooked, from the exercise room to the business center, that I plan to take advantage of on our next trip. Beautiful, affordable, tasteful, friendly and conveniently located near the beach and many shops and restaurants and an easy taxi of bus (CHEAP!) ride to lovely Old San Juan, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Now I just have to count down the days until next year's convention to enjoy it again....!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful visit to a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: yad50
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I took a vacation July 24-29 and stayed at the Verdanza which is located in an ideal place Isla Verde. We had a wonderful stay the hotel is located close (a block and a half) to the beach and quick access to Old San Juan. Everyone of the staff at the hotel were polite and more than willing to help with any questions one had. Wed. the hotel had a reception in the eighty 20 bistro for all the guests with free drinks and appetizers which was a pleasant surprise. Our room was great for our needs to rest and recoup after our days of fun. I would love to come back and spend more time we had a wonderful time and were very relaxed at our hotel. Thank you to all of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Made our vacation stay exceptional”
Reviews.Author: IsraelNMarlyn817
Reviews.Content: Besides what you come to expect from a great hotel the Verdanza staff went over and beyond. We misplaced our camera and by chance we called the hotel. They confirmed the camera was there and they shipped to us in Texas. Great rooms, best location and the best staff equals the best vacation. Thanks Verdanza! - Israel

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: yazoo_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from July 23 to 25. It was a major holiday weekend in Puerto Rico, so the hotel was much fuller than usual, especially with local families. That made for a very loud and overcrowded pool area. With that said, the hotel staff was remarkably efficient and pleasant in general, and considering the large crowds they had in particular. Additionally, our room was very clean, comfortable and well decorated, well above average for a budget hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent-- a two-block walk to Isla Verde beach, and walking distance as well to other hotels, restaurants and shops. Our only constructive criticism is that the gym, which is on the top floor with spectacular views, including views of the ocean, is small, the air conditioning there did not work very well at all, and it is adjacent to a computer area where kids were playing unsupervised by adults (they were also playing with the exercise machines-- talk about dangerous!).

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ThatChica088
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great staff! we got a great deal and our breakfast was included. nice pool and separate sprinklers for the kids......not to mention a jacuzzi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: BJ52
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel, close to the beach and didn't cost a fortune. The Verdanza was the place (formerly a Holiday Inn). Hotel is literally five minutes from the airport. We arrived just after midnight on Monday morning and were greeted by the staff in courteous and professional manner. The cityview room was ready and to our surprise,it was very comfortable and cozy. We stayed for five nights. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Hotel restaurants were clean, well staffed and food was delicious. The rooftop computer room and gym are cool, bright and well equipped. The open rooftop is set up for sunning and to view great scenery of ocean and mountains -- so bring your binoculars. The location is great -- one/half block from Isla Verde Avenue (main thoroughfare) and one block from the beach. Once on the beach, you can rent a chair for $4.00 and an umbrella for $10.00 to use for the entire day til -5:30 p.m. Also food and cocktails are available from beach restaurant or snacks from vendors (hot dogs; hamburgers; soft drinks). On Isla Verde Ave -- in case you don't want to eat at the hotel -- there are several fast food restaurants, namely Wendy's, KFC; Burger King; Taco Bell; Long John Silvers; Church's Chicken and Chili's - all in very close proximity (walking distance). Also, Walgreens is in walking distance as are souvenir shops and beauty salon. There's also a bus on I.V. Avenue which runs every 35-40 minutes that will take you to Old San Juan District (75 cents each way exact change). There you can get the free troller service which will take you all around Old San Juan with stops at the historic forts; museums; ferries and shopping district. Only one let-down occurred on our last day. We were informed by the hotel restaurant staff that our breakfast (buffet-style) was complimentary due to the vacation package we chose. We were unaware that breakfast was not complimentary on the checkout day and were not told until we checked out of the hotel and found out we charged $41.00 for breakfast that day. That was totally unfair. We were regulars that week for breakfast and the same person that served us each day should have advised us that breakfast was not complimentary. We enjoyed our stay and would return there for another vacation. However, we will surely ask each day whether breakfast is complimentary or not.

Reviews.Title: “Many features and great location.”
Reviews.Author: LR2010PR
Reviews.Content: We are regular guests at Verdanza Hotel and have been visiting for the last 3 years. Verdanza is perfectly located in Isla Verde, just a few steps from the beach (less than 5 minutes walking), and it's only a 3 minute ride from the airport. Verdanza's many features include 3 excellent restaurants with different menus (J.H. Yee's Asian Bistro, Colada's, and Eighty20 Bistro), 3 wine/cocktail bars (including DiVino Wine & Tapas, which recently opened), a big swimming pool (w/ kids' area), a dessert/coffee shop (David's Cookies), and many services related to excursions, sightseeing, car rental and airline's check-in. Its location, close to the beach and with many outside restaurants and casinos just a few steps away, makes it a great option for its value. I have stayed in Verdanza for business... And we even spent the night of our wedding, before we took off the next day for our honeymoon. Management did a good job on updating rooms, lobby, etc... The result is a chic (almost boutique) hotel, with a great ambiance (lounge vibe). Service is excellent, and management goes out of their way to make sure our stay is one to always remember. Will definitely stay again in Verdanza.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: rosiliana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus our two adult children stayed here from July 1st to the 6th. The hotel itself is lovely without being overdone in it's decor. The rooms were clean and adequate. There was a coffee machine in the room as well as a refrigerator and a safe, all of which we used. Housekeeping was excellent as they really picked up after our two adult children. Towels were plentiful and clean. Restaurants were expensive in the hotel but there are plenty of other options within walking distance (Ponderosa steakhouse, burger king, taco bell, KFC, etc. etc., and the local favorite which served excellent local cuisine Mi Casita. If you want a little nightlife, there are plenty of hotels within walking distance for music, dancing and gambling. The beach is just a small walk across the road from the hotel. Upon checking out I discovered they had a computer portal set up where you could check in to your airline, check in luggage and print your boarding passes all for free! What a wonderful little time saving perk. I would not hesitate to visit this hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: jsctraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here as a result of taking a voluntary "bump" from an airline at the San Juan Airport, so the carrier put us up here overnight. Apparently this used to be a Holiday Inn, but it has been well-maintained. The front desk staff was kind and helpful, the waitstaff in the restaurants (we ate in the hotel's Asian restaurant as well as the wine bar) was professional and very willing to assist us with our selections, the food was very good, and the bellhops were accommodating. (Our taxi arrived in less than a minute at 5 a.m.) We found our guest room well-appointed, clean, and roomy. Our room overlooked the pool and to the ocean beyond. (The hotel is across the main street and within a block of the beach.) The pool is large and surrounded by plenty of lounges. The hotel management needs to be cautious and keep up with maintenance. The hotel could easily slip: the interior of the elevators showed a lot of wear; the guest room we stayed in will soon need to be painted as there are marks on the walls from suitcases probably; the carpet in the halls looks worn in some places. My family's experience at this hotel was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time was a charm”
Reviews.Author: Celest678
Reviews.Content: I will be honest, my first visit over a year ago to Verdanza was not the best, but I was diligent and wrote to the hotel in regards to my various issues. The manager responded, apologized for the shortcomings and offered for me to return again. I understood that they were going through a number of updates & changes, so I wanted to give the benefit of the doubt & revisit. I am glad I did, the staff was wonderful & attentive. I had asked to preview the rooms due to my previous issues and was able to select a wonderful room that did not have any of the damp smell issues that many of the hotels and rooms in the area suffer from. There was a new addition of a wine bar that serves tapas run by a charming man who knew his wine. That is a great addition to the hotel & a move in the right direction for the tone that I think they would more like to capture. Thank you Verdanza & especially the manager for attempting to make right by me. The gesture is appreciated and the revisit was wonderful. Keep going in that direction.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!!”
Reviews.Author: shayde716
Reviews.Content: We booked this vacation package in Feb. 2011 through Bookit.com., and we weren't disappointed!! The staff was very accommodating from the front desk to housekeepers. Thanks to Luiz & Byron, two of the most helpful & liveliest doormen we've ever had the opportunity to become acquainted with.!!! Kudos also to the front desk staff, all of them!!! We stayed there from May 3-10 of this year, and we thoroughly enjoyed every day of our trip.!!! We left too soon!!! We absolutely plan on returning in the very near future to pick up where we left off. Once again, our many thanks to everyone involved for helping to make our stay there a memorable one!!! Sharon F. & Denise S.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: goodgirlost
Reviews.Content: One thing about this hotel that no one else had was bike with a buggy. This guy worked off tips and would take us to near by places, or we could have walked but that was nice! The pool was nice, the place was clean at all times. I was scared by the reviews but the room was really nice also. The only complain i would say is they need to update the tv even the color is going out. OH and at check out we were hit with a $10 fee to TIP the maids, valet ppl, and etc.! That was a first i have ever hear of that. I would stay again, i had no problems, my room was clean everyday, i have plently of towels and during the holidays. Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rating it was given”
Reviews.Author: SherainLB
Reviews.Content: We used priceline to book our hotel the night before our cruise. This place was rated 3-1/2 stars and there is NO WAY it comes close to that. It is a converted Airport Hilton with a beautiful lobby. But that's about it. When we checked in we asked to upgrade our room - so they gave us a "sea view" which means, look through the dirty window, over the parking garage, and between a few buildings to see a silver of the ocean. The bed was uncomfortable - we could feel all the springs through it, several light bulbs were out, there was mold on the ceiling and missing ceiling tiles, The safe didn't work, when my husband opened the closet door the ironing board fell on his head. We had asked the check-in reservationist about eating lunch at the hotel, she sent us down the hall to a closed Chinese restaurant (maybe the front desk should know the open hours for hotel amenities) There were a few really helpful people working at the front desk and the door - we got a bus to town for the day, and a taxi to our cruise ship. But otherwise, I would not return, I would not send anyone to stay here, and I would not give it 3-1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain”
Reviews.Author: andrewgw92104
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for about a week at the Verdanza and were more than satisfied. The public areas -- inside and out -- were immaculate. The staff was wonderful. The lady with the white hair who books tours was a treasure: not only was she friendly, but she was also extremely knowledgeable and gave us great tips (e.g., where to park in Viejo San Juan, how to drive to El Yunque, etc.). The room was quiet and well kept; the heating/air conditioning allowed fine-tuning to suit our tastes (i.e., we didn't have to settle for being frozen or roasted). And the hotel was both extremely close to the airport (though not so close that noise was a problem) and within walking distance of restaurants (fast-food and sit-down), the beach, drug stores, and bus stops. The Chinese restaurant in the hotel was excellent and the bartender there knew how to make a Cosmopolitan. The only criticisms we had were that the in-room Internet service was iffy at best (usually went to the lobby to use the wireless connectivity available there) and there was no place to hang up wet swim suits so they'd dry overnight. All in all, it was a really good deal for a pleasant (if not luxurious) stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: mgr5577
Reviews.Content: Room was big, comfortable bed and pillows, we got corner room and even bigger balcony, clean. Service was very good. Coladas Rest, is one of the best, great food, J.H. Yee Asian Bristro very good food, but Eighty 20 Bistro, the Buffet was terrible, all the food was cold, bacon swiming on grease and they charge you almost 20.00 per person. Rather go out and eat Burger King or McDonals. Never order a la cart since already was disappointed. No free Continental breakfast, No wi-fi available and had to pay for parking. Beach was at walking distance, and the pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love with Puerto Rico all over again..........”
Reviews.Author: maltesa_11
Reviews.Content: My trip was a very special one, visit family members we haven't seen in many years. My mom and I looked Verdanza up on hotwire on a recommendation. I cannot express on happy I was to have chosen to stay here. The people that work here from the person that opens the door to the cleaning staff were all extremely kind, friendly, showed that they really cared for us and if any complaints were made they were diligent to get it resolved immediately. It had been 10 years since I had the opportunity to visit Puerto Rico and this experience opened by heart to return more often. Thank you Verdanza, you are all the best !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Lillieben
Reviews.Content: Hotel Verdanza is a decent looking hotel. Staff was polite and helpful. Rooms on the other hand smell like mildew, seem old and are not kept up. Worst part of our entire stay was that my husband woke up in the middle of the night to find two roaches crawling on the sheets. This happened on our last night, otherwise we would have left immediately. In the morning we informed the manager of our horrible experience he apologized and said he would pass the information to upper management, that's it! Didn't offer anything else (ex. Complimentary breakfast, anything). My opinion of Verdanza Hotel in two words: NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is so good that it can't be made better.”
Reviews.Author: jandcmaintenance
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews prior to trip, most negative. But took a chance anyway because of a 50% off on the 2nd day special that was offered. We spent 1 1/2 days there, post cruise. Pluses were fast check-in by friendly and helpful staff. We came in at 11:00am, 4 hours before 3:00pm check-in time and were told they would call us if the room became available before 3:00pm. Not expecting that call, we went out to eat. They did in fact call us at 1:30 to tell us rooms were ready . A nice gesture was the frozen coconut ice that we were given upon arrival. In fact, we loved them so much that we asked for them on 2 other occasions and were given them cheerfully. Rooms were generally clean however there are areas that need the attention that a 4 or 5 star hotel would not miss, dust on mirror edges, dust on bathroom exhaust vents, noisy hvac system. Their weaknesses are evident in the maintenance end, some walls needed painting, unanchored closet safes, loose shower curtain rods, unnattached ventilated shelving on closet floor and most noticiable, a funky, musty smell in common hall and portion of room. Not offensive but none the less there. We carried 2 way radios with us and were on the same frequency as the maintenance staff and therefore could hear as they addressed the calls, they do try. We were on the 3rd floor which is right over a banquet hall. Music can be heard and felt if you have a room on the 3rd floor, although it does quiet at about 9pm. A $25 drink/food credit that we were supposed to get was not there upon checkout, but was rectified immediately. Their bar "Coladas" has a pricey $10 Margarita which really wasn't worth it. Door men gave us tips that saved us money on a tour, most tours at hotel desk were too expensive. If value is foremost on your list and you can live with some of the above (until they get this together), then this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Verdanza”
Reviews.Author: foxynurseOxford_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Verdanza April 19-24, 2011. I searched for a month online to get a good deal under $1000/pp for flight and hotel. I was a little hesitant to stay there because when it was the Holiday Inn we stayed there in March 2008 and the room was very mildewy-smelling, but I had high hopes things had improved since it had changed ownership, and we really liked the location of the hotel. I booked a poolside room. When we entered the room, I immediately smelled mildew (room 1011) but everything else looked cleaned. Well, by the next day we noticed every time we flushed the toilet, water seeped up around the base. This would be sewer water. You could tell that they didn't use a flange to seal the toilet; just looked over-caulked. Plus, the toilet was crooked. I also noticed that the carpeting in the closet was wet. I would not normally pick up on this, but I had to step into the closet to pick up one of my shoes, and it made a squishy sound. Upon further inspection, the water appeared to be coming from the wall of the closet. Air conditioning leak? Or the plumbing in general?We complained, and were offered the room next door (1010). It also had a mildew smell, but again, everything else looked clean, and the toilet did not appear to leak. By evening, however, we noticed a small river of water going down the crevice in the tile, and then the more we used the toilet, the more it seemed to leak. Even the housekeeper was aware, and said she had told management, and that she didn't know why they didn't use a "donut" (flange) under the toilet! The housekeeper seemed to know more than maintenance, because when maintenance looked at the toilet in room 1011 when we first complained, he looked at us like we had two heads! And, by the way, room 1011 had new occupants in it within 5 hours of us moving next door, so we knew the problem wasn't fixed. After reading the review of another traveler from March of 2011 in the very same room (1011) it's clear they don't take maintenance issues very seriously, because that traveler complained of the very same thing! I just wish i had read that before I decided on the Verdanza. Next time I'll pay a little more and stay at the Intercontinental, like we did one time before!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tooty91
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous with this hotel being in Isla Verde as the airport is not too far away, but I didn't hear airplanes at all!
