This hotel is conveniently located near the airport and the bus stop to take to Old San Juan is only two blocks away across from Burger King(take bus T-5 or C-53, which is $.75 per person each way). We got off the cruise ship and was at the hotel by 10 a.m. The staff was very friendly and was able to put us in a room right away - how amazing!! However, our room was in what looked like the older section, which was disconnected and did not have an elevator. We had to carry our bags up three flights of stairs. But our room had a king size bed and a patio view of the pool - that somewhat made up for dragging our luggage so far away. The pool was very large as was the hot tub. We had it all to ourselves in the evening! We had breakfast at one of their onsite restaurants. I wish I had known that they served more than a buffet as it was rather expensive ($30 for the two of us). There is a menu on the tables, which has cheaper options (we noticed this after we had loaded our plates full. :( Oh well, I'll know for next time. After we checked out, the hotel was very helpful as they stored our luggage at no cost while we went on a tour of the rainforest. Again, amazing staff. I cannot say enough about their staff!! The doorman even grabbed a map and showed us exactly how to get to where we had asked directions for. Great staff Verdanza - Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Molly074
Reviews.Content: Nice location, very close to the beach, nice view (partial of the ocean), great pool and hot tub. I was traveling with a friend, and we both thought the room was very small and the bathroom tiny. The "queen" beds were really just full size and the hotel is too cold (too much air conditioning). Service was only "fair" at best. We had a remote in our room that didn't have a menu button and when we called to have it replaced, it took the staff 45 minutes to bring it to us. We had to call three times to get it. I would expect more from a resort hotel. No room service. The computers in the business center didn't work well. On the plus side the room was very clean and bedding was cozy. Quiet - no noise from hallway or other rooms. The hotel has a great work-out room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Verdanza, not bad but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: JaneNevis80
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a conference in San Juan which had us lodged at the Verdanza Hotel near the airport. So good location. Points : recently refurbished so rooms were fine. Bathroom tile grouts need scrubbed and bleached. All public areas were like staying in Alaska. In the conference room we were all shivering and freezing. Why can't these hotels make A/C an 'ambient temperature in the rooms. We had to ask three times for them to sort it out. Food was bland, but caters to the American market. Went to the new Tapas bar, good wines and the tapas were nicely done. One problem the tapas bar is in the lobby and the management have not seen fit to screen it off with plants or something, so it is dining in the lobby next to car rental desk which encroaches into the space of the restaurant ! Come on management, this is an easy fix to create ambiance. Move the care rental desk nearer to the reception and put in some big potted plants to screen off the rest of the lobby. Our remote control didn't work in the room. It took them 3 days to get us a new one ! So all these are small things, overall yes its fine for a short stay in PR close to old San Juan, close to shopping mall etc. Just... could do better. I rate it 3.5 out if 5, Jane

Reviews.Title: “I WISH I COULD LIVE AT VERDANZA!”
Reviews.Author: Rigo305
Reviews.Content: As a music industry veteran I have stayed in thousands of hotels through out my years and I can honestly say that my experience at Verdanza was one of the best I've ever had at a hotel. Super friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable staff, clean rooms, great location just a block away from the beach and near many restaurants,attractions and shops. When in Puerto Rico, Verdanza is my new home away from home,highly recommend this great hotel, A+ across the board!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for pre or post cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: chrisngary
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Verdanza Hotel the night before our cruise. The hotel is just a short walk to a beautiful beach, restaurants, convenience stores and even a Walgreens. The hotel has it's own restaurants, but we did not eat there so have no comments. The pool area is nice and inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downfall in my opinion is that the rooms are in desperate need of some work. They are very outdated, smell of mildew but are clean and bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Button_382
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little older in the rooms but the service was great. We stayed for a conference and it was affordable, clean and the staff were very friendly. Its really close to Old San Juan (about a 7-10 min drive) so that was nice. The bathrooms are kinda small and dated and the rooms are not that big but all you need for a short stay. A good value for money. I am sure the fancy hotels one street over are really expensive :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay Pool View Room”
Reviews.Author: LoveRiri
Reviews.Content: Ok so after trusting the reviews for this hotel , something told me I might not like it. They are in the process of remodeling, so my advice is do not stay pool view because those are the older rooms which have MINOR upgrades to hide the true flaws. When we first arrived, I asked Joyanne (she pronounces it Joan) are we in a refurbished room, she hesitated, smiled the room has a "carribean feel to it and the other rooms are formal". From that point on I knew not to expect much. We arrived in the room, bed was decent but the room is overall OLD. I have plenty of pictures I will upload soon. The bathroom is beyond horrible, wall below the sink is cracked. Our toilet was crooked, you walk into the bathroom and you have your granite countertop, then a stand up shower, the toilet was crooked, if it were not you would not be able to close the door to the actual shower area. When my boyfriend first entered the bathroom, there was dried urine on the toilet seat and the toilet leaked everytime you flushed it. I did not trust taking a shower bare foot let alone at all in the shower. We called to have the room changed and of course they never got back to us. Its a good thing we were out all day and only slept and shower in the room. The pictures on the website of the rooms are beyond deceiving, beware that they NEVER show any pictures of the bathroom on the website. Do not stay at this hotel. The pool and hot tub were nice at FIRST! We mainly went tout to the pool at night, so we decided on our last day there to lay out most of the day in the day time. The pool was filthy, my boyfriend was in the pool and he saw a bag of crack floating around (of course it fell out of someones pocket obviously). He went to the front desk to tell them the pool needs to be cleaned and they lied and said it is cleaned every morning, we saw someone cleaning the pool for the first time during our last day. Also Internet Connection was very slow, you have to be in the lobby to get good connection! And you pay $10.70 a day for parking, ridiculous. The look of the lobby fools people into thinking this is a good hotel, it is not. The only good thing is the beach is literally on the next block, the Eighty20 Bistro Restaurant in the hotel serves good food and so does JH Yees Asian Restaurant. I would never stay at this hotel again. I do not have the USB for my camera but I will load the pictures of our room. please if you stay at this hotel post pics of your room and bathroom. I was in room 1011. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Verdanza if you can”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Verdanza Hotel was an unpleasant experience, filled with many annoyances, and I would not want to stay there again. We booked through Priceline and paid $91 a night, and even at those prices â€“ much lower than the hotelâ€™s rack rates â€“ I feel we overpaid. One of our belongings was apparently removed by housekeeping, and while it was an inconsequential item, the theft really left us feeling unsettled. We were assigned a room in the hotelâ€™s separate wing with balconies overlooking the pool. The balcony was a plus, since rooms in the main hotel building do not have them, but our pool wing room was poor in many ways: no hot water during our entire two-day stay(!); beaten-up furniture; an older, tube TV; an Internet cable connection that was hard to find in a mess of small wires on the floor beneath the desk; no shampoo. After our room was serviced following the first night of our stay, we were unable to find a round travel neck pillow that probably cost us about $10. One of us had used it the night before and we had not taken it with us or thrown it out. We searched everywhere for it in the room and concluded that it had to have been taken by the hotel housekeeper. That gave us a very uneasy feeling, and we were glad we had left the room that day taking with us our more valuable property, namely our laptop and iPad. We called the housekeeping desk to complain about the pillow, but they simply said theyâ€™d look for it. We were pleased that our room came with two complimentary bottles of Fiji water, the outdoor pool and hot tub were nice, and there was no Internet fee. But, on the downside, the hotel slaps its guests with a sneaky resort fee. Hello, YOU ARE NOT A RESORT but a two-star hotel with a pool! The resort fee was never disclosed at check-in, so I will be disputing those charges with my credit card issuer. Bizarrely, we were charged different resort fees for the different days: $8.80 for the first night and $9.30 for the second. The hotel also would seem to play â€œGotcha!â€� with guests over its pool towels. At check-in, each guest is given a ticket to exchange for a pool towel at the front desk. When you return the towel, you are given another ticket, maybe for the next day. The fine print says that if you do not have a ticket to return to reception when you check out, you will be charged a $20 fee. I imagine many guests toss out the tickets and are hit with the fee. The final major negative for this hotel is that you must in fact stand in line at reception to check out, there is no sort of express checkout. We left at noon and had to wait in a long line to be helped by just one reception agent on duty, at a time when many people were checking in and checking out. For us, it was the final insult.

Reviews.Title: “best value in isle verdi”
Reviews.Author: boonan
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd trip to the verdanza hotel. staff and hotel were amazing!! close to the beach, and all restaurants. I think that this hotel is the best value in san juan. will definitely be back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money I paid, but next time I would choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: natakerr05
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, bathroom was extremely small. There was just one trash can per room (including bathroom). Bed was bent in the middle. Stuff was very friendly. Pool area is great: nice garden, wide pool, big hot tub. Coladas restaurant was my worst experience ever. We waited one and a half hour for our food, which was in very small amount on a dish and overroasted without any veggies or sauces (except ketchup in a big bottle). Even though we paid a fair amount of money, we left the restaurant hungry. They charged us for half a glass of wine as for full one (there was no menu for drinks). While sitting there, we saw a few clients disputing their receipts. In contrast with it, bistro Eighty20 was very good with amazing food (delicious calamari, shrimps, margarita) and excellent waiter. Panderosa steakhouse (across the street) was very good with buffet where you can eat a lot for affordable money. In the lobby you can order different tours. We liked 1/2 day rainforest trip. Guide Tony was very nice and very good driver. I would not recommend to rent a car, since there was traffic without any rules (pretty easy to get into accident or be lost on the super narrow roads to rainforest). Beach is nice and pretty close to the hotel, not very crowded. Although pets are not allowed on a beach, we saw a lot of owners with dogs. Their pets were relieving themselves close to us. Avoid secluded areas of a beach because of possibility to be robbed. We saw two very strange guys playing with rackets without any belonings. They appeared from nowhere in front of us and approached our belonings when we were in the ocean . When we changed our location they left. So, if you can't afford much money for your vacation, then this hotel is a good option. In general, in San Juan watch your purse, all belonings and check out all receipts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for value, service and location.”
Reviews.Author: thedirtydozen
Reviews.Content: We were based here for 8 days, (actually 9 bc our flight was canceled) in Feb. We couldn't have chosen better. It was thru USAirways that we heard of this deal-with hotel, airfare, all taxes and breakfast included, so we decided to give it a try after checking it out the hotel reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. It's a smaller hotel, locally run, just one block to the Isla Verda beach (lovely), bus stops to Old San Juan (.75c ride), plenty of places to eat, shop & close to casinos (Intercontinental, El San Juan, Embassy Suites). You r greeted at the airport by someone the hotel sends to pick u up. U arrive n r given an ice cold coconut ice while u register (delish). The lobby is newly refurbished. There r 3 places to dine, all of them very good. The new Wine n Tapas Bar wasn't open yet to our disappointment. The prices r reasonable. EVERYONE is very friendly, helpful, courteous. What a pleasure! We had friends join us for the day at the end of their cruise (with 2 children) n the staff couldn't have been any more helpful, acting as if our guests were also guests of the hotel. We enjoyed the beach, the pool (even had a little water park for kids), and the nearness of Old San Juan. Easy access for tours to the rain forest and the Bio Bay (a must see), and whatever else u might want to do. The rooms were clean, water was hot, the only complaint I have is that they really need to be updated.........which I hope will be done before we return, as we fully intend to do! Luis and his buddies there to help u. Tell Angie & Jim sent u! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Morgan0816
Reviews.Content: Walking into the hotel I was very amazed, the lobby area was nice as well as the staff. I was happy we chose to stay at this hotel, until we got off the elevator to go to our room. The hallway smelled like mildew. The room appeared to be decent at first sight until I looked into the bathroom. The bathroom was gross not mentioning extremely small also the vent in the bathroom was very dirty and the wall had water dripping down, and the shower had black stains. The carpet next to the bathroom was damp. The beds were just ok. The tv was old and keep fading out. There was no wifi internet, so i called the front desk and they said I would need a e-cord but they didn't have anymore. The next day we had to change rooms because the toilet started leaking. At first they tried to give us a hard time but then they finally changed our rooms and gave us free breakfast for the rest of our tenure. But for this price I would stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free is not always worth it”
Reviews.Author: LisaBgrrr
Reviews.Content: We were comp'd the room due to a nearby hotel where we had reservations having an issue where they could not provide us with our accommodations. Yuck. We were on the courtyard by the pool and everyone who went by could be heard. The room is exceeding small. The shower is practically on top of the toilet and no wonder that the door frame of the bathroom rotted out. This was the first room in a while where I felt compelled to actually search for bedbugs before unpacking long enough for my one night stay. Fortunately I found NONE but the room was none the less kind of creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Few Day in PR”
Reviews.Author: Nori_Petra
Reviews.Content: Good location. A lovely property within walking distance to the beach. Responsive employees and good clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bookend2505
Reviews.Content: I had been doing a lot of research for my and my fiance's first trip to Puerto Rico. After considering locations, prices, reviews, and amenities, I decided to give the Verdanza a try. Being in the hospitality industry, I know that hotels that aren't attached to a big brand often try a little harder to earn your business. The Verdanza is an example of this, and I'm glad that I took a chance on them! The hotel is located a few blocks from the beach, close to some great restaurants (definitely visit Mi Casita!) and the staff were friendly and quite helpful. The price was very reasonable, and the grounds were well kept. At check in, we received complimentary frozen treats which were a nice touch. The front desk was quick and efficient even when the lobby was pretty busy. The concierge desk gave very good info on tours and directions. My room was upgraded to one in the tower on the 8th floor executive level instead of the building near the pool which is where it sounded like I was originally placed when I called back to reconfirm our reservations. This was great because I was a little worried about noise from the pool area in my room, and the pool building seemed to be where some people stayed and noted mildew smells. The executive level had a gym and business center with internet right down the hall, and exclusive access to a continental breakfast each morning we were there. We also rented a car for a few days to allow ourselves scheduling freedom and again, the desk couldn't have been more helpful. The only three issues I had were: * the hotel's restaurant. While the food was good, the service was a little slow. I think there were staffing shortages the day I ordered lunch. I had calamari and a mojito and it took 25 minutes, and I had to check on it more than once * my exec room: although well appointed, it was pretty small. The balcony I had did not have room to sit; the pool building seemed to have bigger balconies with chairs, but I can't speak to the size of the rooms there. * my room was not ready at check in, but to be fair we did get there at 9 am when the hotel was sold out the previous day. The desk did take my cell phone number and call me when the room was ready, and it was...exactly at the time they said it would be. I unfortunately missed the manager's reception, which was also a nice touch. I would've liked to meet the manager to tell him directly what a great hotel and wonderful team he has. Thanks in part to the Verdanza, my fiance and I had a fantastic and memorable vacation in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: skr23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2008 when it was the Holiday Inn. I was very surprised then how clean the hotel was and how helpful the staff was that when I booked my cruise for Feb. 2011 my husband and I decided we should try the Verdanza because we were familiar with the area and the price was right. (We have stayed at the Intercontinental before as well and did'nt want to spend $400+ for one night before a cruise) We booked a room for one night before our cruise and for 2 nights the next week after our cruise. There was a fire alarm at 5:45 a.m. And the room phone and safe were not working. I informed the front desk about the phone not working and the safe. I also asked if I could have that same room when I returned the next week. It had a balcony and a view of the pool. We returned the next week and while checking in the front desk person said to my husband "someone should be up soon to look at the phone". No-one ever showed to fix anything. And while we were there for our 2 night stay the fire alarm went off 3 more times. All false alarms. I did not say anything about the phone or safe again because they made it pretty clear they just didnt care. They had a whole week to fix it and chose to do nothing about it. Also the David's coffee shop located in the lobby has the worst customer service I stood there for 5 min and the person behind that counter was on their cell phone and did not acknowledge me or the other women behind me. We both walked away. This happened all 3 days I was there. There is a Starbucks in the El San Juan hotel but I just wanted a quick cup before I got on with my day. The best part about that is I walked over to Mi Casita (over by church's chicken and burger king) they have good coffee and a good inexpensive breakfast. I will be staying at the Intercontinental from now on when I come to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: cie1980
Reviews.Content: it was my worse stay EVER...the tv didnt work, fire alarm went off every night, and the charge my card twice the amount and the hotel manager said it was my PROBLEM

Reviews.Title: “Great Value price”
Reviews.Author: Bre37421
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, the hotel was nice looking, and the hotel's restaurant served good food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ryan5027
Reviews.Content: The room we had was a little small, but you shouldn't spend much time in your room while in Puerto Rico anyway. The staff at the desk was awesome to my wife and me. They recommended places to eat and helped with directions. The hotel is close to some good resaturates and the beach. There are bus stops close by that will take you to Old San Juan or if you want you can get a cab very easily.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueTripAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The power was on and off all night and finally stayed off the morning after therefore NO AC and it gets hot fast. No hot water even after letting the water run for 10 mins. The phone was broken and the hotel MGR Juan could care less what happened to my room and stay.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: MickBaby8
Reviews.Content: My husband recently had a business trip and so I went with him and we stayed at the Verdanza Hotel. Wasn't overly impressed and found the hotel to be an average hotel. The lobby area was very nice but the rooms were outdated. We are generally a pretty easier going couple and very rarely change rooms but we had to do so at Verdanza. Our first room we got there was a bunch of hairs in the bathroom (ew!), the remote control didn't work which was proabably due to the batteries, but when we tried to call down to get new batteries, the phone wasn't working either. There would be a dial tone, but when we dialed to Front Desk, or Housekeeping, it just went dead and would take forever before the dial tone came back up again. The sink also seemed to be clogged. So we got a new room which was a bit better but not by much. Our sink worked on and off during our stay and the water was lukewarm in our shower at best. There were cracks in the walls and the tub had mildew. The bed was also too hard for my liking. All in all I don't feel we got good value for our money. It was only an ok hotel. The plus is that it is only a short distance from the beach but perhaps we went at a bad time, but the area was quite dead. Besides the beach there really isn't anything else to do in the immediate vicinity. Cabs are expensive, we took a 15-20 min cab ride to the Plaza des Americas and it cost us US$20. Luckily we had already seen Old San Juan, as I can only assume the cost would have been a lot more to go out there. I had wanted to take a tour the day of my husband's meeting but the hotel didn't really offer a huge variety of tours. The one tour to Ponce that I wanted to take wasn't offered the day I could go, the only other tour was one to El Yunque and a snorkeling tour but those ones didn't really appeal to me. If you want to stay close to the airport then this is a good location but beyond that I don't know if I would recommend it as there isn't a whole lot to do in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for night's stay before and after Cruise”
Reviews.Author: SnoopGirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel for a night before and after our cruise. Excellent staff, food and pool/hot tub area.

Reviews.Title: “Suprise Find”
Reviews.Author: jport
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel when our flight was canceled due to the Blizzard of 2010 and we needed a place for the night. They were offering reasonable rates and were not price gouging like the other places. The staff was very friendly when we checked in and very helpful considering our situation. They offered good suggestions on places to eat in the area. The hotel is an old Holiday Inn that has been converted into a boutique hotel. The room was nice except for the bathroom that could use an upgrade. Although it's not on the beach, it's a 5 minute walk away and the pool area is nice and clean. We ate at Colada's restaurant that night. The food was good but the service was very slow. They were short staffed and I think the staff was more focused on tending the bar and not serving the diners. The other diners there were suprised at the service and commented that the restaurants there were very good.

Reviews.Title: “My daughter and I went to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: EileenTrusk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Verdanza for 5 days. Our bills shocked us. They added to the bill for everything. They charged us for the breakfast that was included by calling it LUNCH. At 9AM. They do this by having you sign for your meals and having them attached to your bill upon leaving. The buffet breakfast was supposed to be included in your stay. If you didn't leave a large enough tip the billed you for that. Doubtful, The toliet ran constantly making a terrible noise, the TV remote control didn't work (TWICE). The pool was nice as was the hot tub area. The food in the restaurants were passable. Parking was 10 dollars a day but you could come and go at will when you got a coin to put into the machine. As I said, the bill shocked us and we debated it and they reduced a 360+ dollar bill to 140 something. They charge you a RESORT FEE which was sizeable and not mentioned in the advertisement. And while they deleted it, the fact that it was added in the first place is disconcerting. How many people would not complain and pay it rather than know what and how much they are supposed to pay. That is upsetting.... While the weather was beautiful the problems we faced at the hotel made our vacation more of a plight than a pleasure. AND the toilets plugged up at least twice and would NOT flush

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Lousy concierge - Don't buy any tours, waist of money!”
Reviews.Author: WNY_Voyager
Reviews.Content: All in all this was a great place. Let me get the unpleasantness out of the way first - Lousy concierge. We arrived at the hotel and went first to the concierge with regard to transportation into Old San Juan. The bellhop mentioned to us that a bus cost 75 cents into Old San Juan and took about 35 minutes as compared to a taxi which costs $25 (plus tip) and takes 15 minutes anyway. We asked the concierge about it and she said take the C-53 there and back, it will pick you up in the same place it drops you off and buses run all the time â€“ bus stop close to the hotel. We took the bus in and everything was great until 7pm when we walked back to where we were dropped off. Not only did the C-53 not show up (after we waited 45 minutes) but there were so few buses that late that we werenâ€™t even sure what was running. After taking a $25 (plus tip) taxi back to the hotel we talked to the bellhop who told us that at this hour we would only be able to catch the T-5 back because the C-53 was not running as often but the T-5 takes only a few minutes more and drops off at the same place (we did see the T-5 but never considered taking because we were told C-53). Well everyone has a bad day so the next morning we went back to the concierge and asked about a hike in the rainforest. My wife and I are active hikers and were looking for an all day hike through El Yunque. She jumped into action and said great and no problem and booked us an â€œall day hikeâ€� for $68 per person. We were picked up at 9:45 and retuned to the hotel by 3pm (all day?). In total we â€œhikedâ€� for 1 hour which was down a paved trail to a waterfall and back (Guide did not come along). The rest of the time on our tour our guide took us to souvenir shops, a cave opening, lunch at a local kiosk place and drove a round about way to get to El Yunque. The guide was pleasant enough and the tour was fine it just wasnâ€™t what we wanted or what we paid ($136) for. This tour was a waist of a day and money. When we arrived back to the hotel we explained our grievances with the concierge about this not being an all day hike and she actually said these words to us: â€œOh, you wanted a hike hikeâ€�. This woman was neither friendly nor helpful and we never talked to her again. I canâ€™t believe I received better advice and guidance from a bellhop! Other then the above the room was clean, maid was excellent, the staff (other then the concierge) was nice and helpful and the restaurants were expensive but good. Try the Isla Verde Fettuccine, itâ€™s to die for. Rental car (Dollar) right in the lobby. Location is far from Old San Juan so be brave and take the bus or be a spendthrift and take taxis. After our miserable trip to El Yunque we rented a car and spent a real day hiking the rainforest on our own. Good beaches right across the street from the hotel and the neighborhood is upscale. Pool and hot tub were great and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Were Looking for in a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: jneil
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel at the end of our cruise. Our flight was not until 2 AM on Monday, so we wanted a decent hotel near the airport for a reasonable price and Verdanza fit the bill. We arrived at 10:30 AM on Sunday and they were able to get us into a room within 15 minutes (we had contacted them earlier requesting this). Room: Our room was a city view on the 5th floor and it was spacious and clean. Upon arrival, we were happy to see that they had provided us with two free bottles of Fiji water. The room also had a mini- refrigerator. We had a king sized bed and flat screen television. This is an older hotel that has had some recent updates but still needs some more. The bathroom seemed updated except for the tub and stained and broken ceiling tiles. Even though we were close to the airport, we could barely notice the sounds of the planes. The only noise we heard from the hallway was our neighborâ€™s door every once in a while. Grounds: On the eighth floor is a nice little gym and an outdoor patio. The ground level has a computer to check in for your flights. They were decorated for the holidays and it was quite pleasant. The pool area was quite large with plenty of chairs and a hot tub which was overrun by children. My husband and I just laughed since we had just gotten off a cruise with the same situation (we donâ€™t use the hot tubs with kids). I wish some resorts would actually enforce the age limits that are posted!! They had a childrenâ€™s area which was quite cool and seemed to be very popular. We only stayed here an hour (had lunch) and then walked down to the beautiful beach which was a quick two blocks away. There is a place where you can rent chairs and umbrellas but we walked a little to the right (in front of the Intercontinental) and plopped our butts. This is a beautiful beach with large waves but still swimmable. Restaurants: We ate lunch inside the hotelâ€™s bistro. We were the only ones in there at the time. The waitress was friendly and pleasant. We both had a fish sandwich (I had red snapper, my DH tuna) and split them. They were delicious. My pina colada was the best one of my whole vacation and the most reasonable at $5. My DH also loved the coconut flan. This was a great lunch and very reasonable in price. Before heading to the airport, we ate a late dinner in their Asian restaurant, Johnny Yees. Again we were the only ones in there but it was a late Sunday. We split a bunch of appetizers and once again, they were very good and reasonable. We took naps after the beach and before dinner. The bed was on the hard side but what bothered me the most was the quality of the sheets and pillowcases. They were very stiff and scratchy. We checked out after midnight for our quick ride to the airport (all of 6 minutes!). This hotel met our expectations and was just what we were looking for. We tend to lean towards luxury when on vacation, and this is not a luxury hotel but that is not what we were looking for that day. We knew we were only going to be there for 14 hours so we wanted a comfortable, clean spot at a reasonable price and the Verdanza delivered. This is a very reasonable hotel and is perfect for the budget traveler and/or families. If we were in this situation again, we would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: MAXII
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am and expected to have to store our luggage until late afternoon as rooms are not usually available this early in the day. We had "won" the room via Priceline but this made no difference to the check-in staff - they offered to upgrade our room if we were willing to take a room with two Queens as opposed to 1 King or we were given the option of storing luggage until a room became available! How nice was that - we took an upgrade and had a beautiful and spacious room overlooking the very nice pool area. The friendliness of the staff, bar and restaurant staff, management, reception, housekeeping, doormen etc. was wonderful. Whenever someone passed us, we were always greeted or asked how our day/night was going. Further to the friendliness of the staff, one day, we were sitting at the pool and the trees were being shed of the coconuts. A guy (manager possibly) had the guy taking down the coconuts prepare a few so that folk around the pool could drink the milk. What a treat for those of us who only get to eat processed coconut and have never tasted the natural milk. Service was fabulous - the hair dryer stopped working but within the hour it had been fixed, the restaurant, coffee booth and bar staff were helpful and friendly too. Bar and restaurant prices very reasonable but there are plenty of fast food or more luxurious restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. Within the hotel itself, there is a Davis coffee bar that serves quick bites like sandwiches, muffins, candy bars and great coffee. Baked items were always very fresh. In addition there is a bar, bistro where you can get a buffet breakfast or off a menu items - very good food; and, a chinese restaurant. Less than a 3 minute walk to the beach, bus to Old San Juan was 75cents though it is best to avoid the local rush hour 3pm/5pm. Free wi-fi in the reception area and also a computer for printing out boarding passes. Also on the 8th floor their is a lounge with a computer (free to use) and rooftop patio area. Pool very clean and has a kids water park and hot tub along with an area with a giant chess set you can play with. There are lots of covered and uncovered seating areas too. There are plenty of pubs, souvenir shops, a Walgreens and many other restaurants and fast food places within walking distance of the hotel. Hotel itself is well maintained, clean and rooms are cleaned well and ours was always cleaned by the time we had returned from breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel except for the pool”
Reviews.Author: RussJ35
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that my girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Everyone who works at the hotel was so nice and helpful and the price of a room was a steal. The Verdanza hotel is in very close proximity too everything in the Isle Verde area. Your a two min walk too the beach, your also a two min walk too all the other major hotels in the area. We had one issue with the hotel during our stay, the pool was filthy. I don't think it was cleaned during our stay over the columbus weekend. My girlfriend developed a rash on her chest from the water after just one day in the pool, needless too say we never made it back in. We visit Puerto Rico 5 to 7 times a year and would like too to give the hotel another shot but we need some kind of reassurance from management that this porblem will never happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding/extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Boricua51
Reviews.Content: Quite a story, we where in our wedding celebration which was in another location, and we had stayed in the Marriott Courtyard in Isla Verde (nearby). I had booked a reservation in the Verdanza (back then it was a Holiday Inn when I'd booked the room) for my Maiden of Honor to stay; I'd also used the room for us and my mother to prepare ourselves for the wedding which was a daytime wedding/reception. I never knew that the hotel was under a transition of merging with the Summit family. At the moment we didn't paid attention to details, etc. The photographer came and took several pictures in the room which looking at them it was very beautiful. My favorite picture was the long window reflecting in the sunlight and my flower girl and I holding hands looking at each other....wow it looks like an angel just came through the curtains......after that we all went down for departure, when the elevators opened and we all stepped out (me behind) everyone frozed just glanced at us....and the people started to applauded when we was leaving the hotel. Due it was after thanksgiving day the hotel looked very nice w/all the x-mas decorations....We didn't stay there for the honeymoon because we already had prior reservations at the Marriott.....due my Maiden of Honor left the property and we had decided to extend our stay in the Marriott, but they had a big convention coming in which made it impossible for us to stay there and at that moment I told my husband about "Verdanza". We packed up our things and went directly to Verdanza which for my surprise the front desk agent recognized me. Very impressive. We told him about our situation and he helped us out. At the moment they didn't have standard queen rooms or suite due to the holidays but they had a double bed room with balcony overviewing the pool which we took (gave us a special rate too). We enjoyed ourselves there and if we knew better we could had done our wedding there too....next time!....renew our vows!.... We where in the right place and the right time, that night the celebration of Verdanza began w/fireworks displaying their new name "VERDANZA"....everynight for a week there was live music in the lobby area which the guests where invited to be part of their staff and celebration of the new beginning. Everynight was a different theme. We felt that we was part of their staff due we work for a very known hotel which was recently renovated and opened doors in 2008 located at the gem of Miami Beach... We dine in J.H. Lee's Asian restaurant which was so delicious and the service was great! The server's knew their menus and gave suggestions too. At the next morning we went to Eighty 20 Bistro and had breakfast and we ate our hearts off. When you go in you feel you transported to the 60's. DELICIOUS!!!... The quality of the food is excellent and fresh (I should know I work for an executive chef too). The furnitures of the lobby and surroundings are refreshing it also goes with the atmosphere. Back at home we recommend the hotel to our friends if they plan to visit PR. When I come to visit again PR, definitely we will look into Verdanza, well we kind of opened the place. OH!!!!! Let's not forget the staff "YOU RULE!"

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLovesFrance
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Verdanza for 4 nights recently as solo traveler to San Juan. Would definitely recommend the rooms in the tower; the room I was first assigned was in the poolside section and was just too damp and old for my taste but I was kindly moved to a newer, nicer room and very much enjoyed my stay. The room was quiet and the bed extremely comfortable. Used the computers on the 8th floor; reasonably fast internet in my opinion. Didn't use the fitness center up there but it looked well-outfitted and the view from that floor was profound! There's a deck outside the business/fitness area with views to the beach. Check it out! The staff is very friendly and helpful and it was pretty easy to get around from the hotel. Had to take taxis if going away from Isla Verde area for dinner (ie. Condado). As others did, used the bus to go to Old San Juan; it might take 30-40 mins for it to arrive, and it took about 40 mins to get to OSJ, but at 75 cents each way, worth it (and you get to see other parts of the city on the way). A little tip: at the top of the city, near El Moro, there is an art school and inside a courtyard with a little place that sells some very fresh and yummy puerto rican snacks and meals. I happened upon it sort of accidentally and took advantage of the cool seats in the courtyard, the very clean bathrooms and the water fountain. You can't normally go in, but I asked about eating there and gained admittance. They will not let you just go in and use the bathrooms. Other food related tips: Ate breakfast twice in the hotel; $12.00 buffet, which felt a little high but was convenient and if you're a big eater, a good deal. Had a tuna nicoise salad at the 80/20 restaurant, which was delicious except for the tuna (!) which was a tad dry. As for the lettuce wraps at J H Yees, yup, those are amazing and should not be missed! Eat them like tacos; still a little messy but yummy! I also ate at Jam Rum Bar which others have recommended on TripAdvisor and it was very good; agree with others that the white bean soup is to die for. The black truffle oil on top is such a treat. When I was there, they also had a black bean soup so I tried a little of both and would vote, just barely, for the black bean if available. Also had the postelon pernil which was super filling and tasty. And Mia Casita, just around the corner from the Verdanza--near the Ponderosa (eek!) was great! I had rice and beans with the beef a la native--marinated and laced with onions. It was enough for two meals, and with a fridge in the hotel room, it was leftovers the next night :) Outings which should not be missed include El Yunque rain forest, and the snorkling trip--both available and recommended through Castillo tours (they maintain a desk in the lobby of the Verdanza, and you can also call them directly if no one there). I booked both the night before and they made my trip! Met some very fun people on both! The hotel has a nice pool and is truly a very short walk to the beach. I did not feel at all like I needed to be on the beach; I get the feeling my hotel was quieter for being a little further back. Weather was certainly hot and a little steamy, but only rained for 30 mins the whole time I was there. Stunning! Hope you go!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: NJWil
Reviews.Content: When our flight from San Juan to Newark returned, after about 40 minutes in the air, to San Juan due to a minor mechanical problem, which could not be repaired right away, the airline put us up for the night at the Verdanza. Although I was extremely fatigued by the time I checked in, I couldn't help but notice what a beautiful, elegant, and clean hotel it is. I had to return to reception because we initially put in a room with only one bed, but that was immediately fixed. The beds were soft, but comfortable, and the air-conditioning was powerful (a rarity for San Juan), and with a fair sized bathroom stocked with plush towels and the usual toiletries. Reception provided a hair comb upon request. Hotel has a large, impressive looking pool; about an hour in that pool was the cure for my earlier fatigue. Of the three restaurants (Asian bistro, International, and Puerto Rican), we choose to dine at the Asian bistro. What a remarkable restaurant! The menu included entrees from practically every major Asian cuisine (except Korean). I had the Jakarta shrimp curry, which was excellent, and my Dad had a Polynesian pineapple chicken. While walking my dog (the hotel is pet friendly!), I noticed the large parking lot behind the hotel. Overall, if we had to be stranded overnight in San Juan, we were fortunate that Continental Airlines put us up in the Verdanza. Our stay at the Verdanza made a stressful and tiring day end on a more relaxed note.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: nycmdiehl
Reviews.Content: Don't let the reviews fool you>>>I have stayed everywhere from The Raleigh and The Delano in Miami to The Mandalay Bay in Vegas...The Verdanza was great..A nice boutique hotel a block from the beach, a block from other mainstream hotels...a short walk to a major 24 hour supermarket..>It was very convenient and the staff really goes out of their way to assist and make your stay perfect..I asked for a more quiet room and was told the same day they had already changed it - before I arrived...I needed peace and quiet and just wanted to relax and I got just that. Contienental breakfast was very convenient....Do NOT waste your time eating at The Palm's or Ruth's Chris - The Verdanza's own Eighty/20 Bistro blew them away...My boyfriend is in the restaurant business and was very impressed..After one night eating at The El San Juan hotel - all of our meals were at The Eighty/20....I would definitely go back...Maria and staff were great...The housekeeper was extremely efficient / daily basis..You cannot ask for more..Actually, I'm sure you can and the hotel staff would oblige. Also, a quick local bus ride for 75 cents takes you straight to Old San Juan !! Check out the jewelry shops in Old San Juan :)

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL TRIP.”
Reviews.Author: isa721
Reviews.Content: To the staff : I just want to thank everyone of the Staff members Michelle who check us in she was great, we laughted and joked as though we know each other for a long time. Emily and Jenifer who helped us with our reservations. And of course Andrew who took care of our luggage and my six year old granddaughter feel head over heals. I would like to talk about the Hotel itself. The pool was great clean and the water tidbit just right when you came down the steps. The restaurants had the best food ever. The first night we eat at Coladas wooooooooooooohoooooooo. The drinks that Nina made were awesome. 8020 was also excellent and their service well outstanding. We spend 10 nights and on the 11th day everyone was sad and not ready to go home . All we can think of is when are we going back Hopefully soon. Again to all at the hotel i want to thank you soooooo much for everythin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mechy1219
Reviews.Content: this was the first time to puerto rico in 3 years and the first time in this hotel. i must say it was a beautiful hotel. the people were extremely friendly and courteous. the rooms were clean and pretty. the food and drinks were delicious. especially the mojitos and coladas. i would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall...(beside the few gliches)”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Life7707
Reviews.Content: Verdanza was great. We went for a week prior to my husband deploying & overall was good. A few gliches though-we booked it thru expedia. We were told to book a car rental @ the hotel because it was easier & we'd have some their to pick up. We did NOT have a car available. All over the car rental places were sold out!! I was beyond pissed that we were told to just wait, & we were assed out. A man working @ Verdanza named Jose hooked us UP! He contacted a friend who works @ a diff hotel & she got us a car that JUST arrived! [Jose you are AWESOME!] OHH but be prepared to pay for parking almost EVERYWHERE u go! even @ the hotel(food for thought) :) *There was still some construction down the street, so traffic was a bit hectic- but the walk to the beach was less than 5 mins. *Check in was ok- we got delayed & didnt arrive til 2am. The hotel overall looked great!! Beautful colors, ect.. The man put us in a room upstairs behind the pool. I was NOT a happy camper. There was only stairs & I was a week post surgery on my abdominal(requesting an easier acess room) and my request wasnt granted). && our view was the BACK of pizzahut & the garbage smell was immense! I did NOT like this @ all.[3 days into our 6day stay, one of the managers offered us a different room- but @ that point, we didnt wanna move all our belongings, so just sucked it up. Plus we were only in the room to sleep & get dressed anyways! * We did have a balcony of the pool view. The pool was great. Always towel & chairs available. Things to do: -Kayaking @ the Biolumineces Bay.. its an amazing experience!!!! You can book it @ the hotel & they will pick you up there! Think it was like 80pp but well worth it. -Go to Old San Juan & the Moro!! Not too bad of a drive, but its amazing! U'll also find alot of souvineer shops.(wear sunscreen & comfu shoes! Its alot of walking but well worth it!! Great pics!!) -Also check out Loiza for some decent food & a nice beach. OHHHHHHHHHH & IF u plan on having some decent food- Coladas in the hotel, AMAZING!! We ate there 3x in our stay! The Mondongo was great! Also, the lil plaza up the street has a spanish restautrant that was always packed for bf/lunch/dinner, but the food is on point & good prices. Feel free to contact me! I have lots of pics. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never was unhappier with a hotel - Subpar rooms & Several issues”
Reviews.Author: Celest678
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in our stay at Verdanza hotel in Isla Verde. When I booked originally, I was told that it was a 4 star hotel, that certainly did not seem the case during my trip. I've have never written a bad review before in my travels but felt compelled to do so now. I have contacted them directly to complain (with other details from the trip) and they said they would look into the issues discussed. When we checked in we were greeted nicely & some of the staff there really do try (unfortunately the overall issues overcloud them). One major plus was Coladas, the staff there were the ones that really did try & make us feel welcome. The food was good, as well as the drinks. They really check up on us to even see if we were happy with service. I can honestly give them a positive rating. Now onto the issues, in summary... First I was given the wrong room designation (pool ground no balcony, which as another reviewer said, smelled & was musty), then I was switched to another room. When I checked into the room, I was horrified. I called my husband up to be sure and judge as well. The room was the last one on the second floor all the way in the corner, it had a smell to it, and seemed as it hadnâ€™t been aired out in a while. The chair in the room was in shambles, the plastic covering on the chair was completely stripped showing the exposed cushion foam underneath. I went back to the front desk, explained the problem & detailed some of the problems & was switched again. The room was not in optimal shape as well, but had less of a smell that other room & appeared to be not as damaged as the previous room we were in. The bed was firm, but with only three flat pillows, we awoke with neck pain in the morning. We had other issues as well, luggage not being transferred with the room, internet connection issues, even cleaning services. If you would like more details let me know! Essentially I have been in no frills places, as well as top of the line. no matter what, if you are made to feel welcome and the staff is friendly & accommodating, it makes all the difference. I had to make this trip, unfortunately for a funeral, so the accommodations were last minute. If i had known, or had more time, I would not have booked there at all, if anything it added to the whole stress for the family.

Reviews.Title: “A city hotel, not great access to beach, poor service”
Reviews.Author: drironwoman
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel during our ten day trip. I chose it because it was one of two hotels chosen as the "hq" for an event I was participating in. The other was the Embassy Suites which was across the street. Practical issues first - if you have a GPS, ask the hotel if the street that runs in front of the hotel is one way or two way. It is currently a one way street due to construction and you will not be able to turn into the hotel the "easy" way. So, if you're staying here, get very precise instructions on how to find the road that turns into the Embassy Suites that will get you to the Verdanza. And be aware that the road is not well marked and will suddenly appear ("like magic as a local put it) and you should be in the right lane to make that turn. The beach is not really near the hotel. You have to walk about 500 yards (?), basically you have to walk down the currently one way road to the busy road, cross it, and go behind the hotels and buildings that front the beach. So, maybe a 6 minute walk depending on how fast you walk. You can hire lounge chairs for $4 once you're on the beach. The pool with the August heat was really bath water temperature (if they had fountains like the other hotel we stayed in, it would have helped with the circulation, I suspect). They do have a water spray play area for kids which I saw children enjoy. The room is decent, we had two double beds. The bathroom is small but adequate. There is a hotel safe and a fridge. The internet is rather slow. The location is good because it is in Isla Verde, so you can walk to fast food places, restaurants, and there is a Charlie's car rental place on the main road. There is also a large supermarket called Pueblo near by (really driving distance, it would be a very long walk if you're loaded down with supplies). The scenery around the hotel is "urban". A friend called it getho style. The Embassy Suites would have been more comfortable. Service at the Verdanza is uneven to poor. We came back at 5pm one day to find the room had not been cleaned after we left early that day. We called and called room service. We had no clean towels. Finally at 9pm, after another phone call, room service came. She had a friend with her, and spent her time casually chatting with him, which of course involved having to stop working at times to have a conversation about mutual friends. not professional at all. one evening, I asked the concierge about pizza. I asked him about the pizza joint in the Embassy suites, he said he never heard of it. I asked him about the pizza place in the Howard Johnson, he said he didn't know there was one (it's about a 3 minute drive). He said there was one down the road, but he didn't have a menu and didn't have a phone number, and that was it. I walked across to the Embassy Suites and decided against that pizza place. I asked THEIR concierge about the Howard Johnson's pizza (it's called Fazzios and is a restaurant that happens to be in the HJ). He thought they were closed and I expressed surprise as friends had just eaten there. So you know what the Embassy Suites Concierge did? He called howard johnson and found out they were open and made it easier for me to order take out pizza. (they will deliver for $3 - fazzio's, they also have a website but it was down that evening). I was very disappointed with the Verdanza. It wasn't worth the money. We had just left Numero Uno which provided breakfast, was right on the beach and were service oriented. And we went on to the Conrad which while a much larger hotel and a resort type hotel, provided excellent service at all times. Re restaurants - Barrachine has local food and is a good choice, and is quite close (we drove) to the Verdanza. Fazzio's will deliver. there is an outback steakhouse in the embassy suites (if you're too tired to drive and don't want to look for a place to eat). I also saw Chile's and Ponderosa near by. There's also a local place called Platos (need to drive or a nice long walk) and Metropol (which I"ll review later) also local food. Parking by the way will cost $10.70. And if they are hosting an event, it may be hard to find a spot to park in the outdoor parking area (there isn't a covered area). I'd say this is a 2 star hotel. So as long as you know what you're getting, you won't be disappointed. It was the service or lack thereof that disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JOANN19
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and not updated. Nice staff but after many promises couldn't get us a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in anothe place”
Reviews.Author: TTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: At first we though we were lost, looking for our room. They send us to the pool area(the worst) Old furniture, broken chair and table, dusty walls and fixtures and smelly room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AdiSilva
Reviews.Content: Overall, the experience was excellent, great staff, comfortable room, super clean pool. Very good hotel. I will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: carybenn53
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect before we arrived, but, was pleasantly surprised! The staff were all so helpful and courteous!! They have done a nice job of refurbishing what was once a Holiday Inn. I had lunch out by the pool 2 or 3 times and thoroughly enjoyed my meals!!! I highly recommend the Caprese Salad and Chicken Caesar Salad!! Oh, and a little guy sitting at the table next to me had chicken nuggets for lunch that looked delicious!!! Be sure to try the Lettuce Wraps at the Asian restaurant! They were delicious, as were the tempura vegetables! The hotel is located a block away from an absolutely wonderful beach!!! A short walk up the beach there is a marvelous restaurant/grill at the Intercontinental Hotel that serves a dynamite Cuban sandwich!!! There is also fast food available just a short walk from the hotel, as well as a Walgreens and a grocery store. Oh, and I enjoyed chatting with other guests out at the pool. There was a family there from Orlando, FL. The mom was born in PR, and she brings her kids and spends the entire summer at the Verdanza. They have been doing this for several years. I figure that is a really great recommendation just by itself!! This hotel is good for families or singles. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “An Expedia Traveler”
Reviews.Author: sangelana
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 nightsThis hotel was perfectly fine for the price we paid. No disturbances, no problems in the room at all. New bedding made for good night's sleeps for every night. Staff was very accommodating and allowed me early check in. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff called to verify that everything meet my needs and that everything was as it should be. We had free breakfast buffets too. Recommend this place to anyone who visits the island. Don't let other reviews fool you. These people are probably way too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vardaman
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for one night before flying out of Puerto Rico. We called this hotel thinking it was still the Holiday Inn. I have to say that this was the nicest room we had the whole time we were in PR, very modern and laid out well. A good use of space. They have apparently remolded recently. I really wish I had stayed there the first night as well. In the room there is a desk with a phone, a radio with an ipod docking station that was cool and a large lounge chair. There was also a cabinet that contained the fridge with a pull out counter. The space was used very efficiently. There was a friendly atmosphere of people staying there, fairly young crowd, 30-ish. The only drawback, which isn't the hotels fault is the access road is under construction and you have to go way around to get there. It's a cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: flo757
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about the Verdanza. Even though only one block from the beach, the Hotel and it's staff were the greatest. Friendly, helpful, and the most accommodating staff I have encountered in a very long time. Though we rarely eat in hotel restaurants, the food at this hotel was reasonably priced and delicious. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the pool area was delightful. Would recommend to anyone wanting a relaxing and very enjoyable time in beautiful Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “under construction”
Reviews.Author: summertime7605
Reviews.Content: Well check in was fine but the room did not get maid services to after 3:00 pm every day and one of the elavatores smelled like mold.....the staff was very friendly the surrounding area was under construction when we stayed and the cable went out on the rainy day...ok if you don't mind being in the urban area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: SebastianTC
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Verdanza Hotel with my wife on our vacation. With the several great options in San Juan, this one seem to bring the best value with all the amenities we were wanting. When we arrived, we were very pleased with the professional and courteous staff, the fantastic location, and the cleanliness/beautiful decor of the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised with how helpful tthe staff was to meet all of our requests. We enjoyed a great breakfast and lunch at the hotel bistro and it was very fun to see the pool and water park being enjoyed by several guests. That night, the bistro was hosting a party with some of Puerto Rico's prominent public figures attending. It appeared the staff was busy, but was still very attentive and professional as we ordered a coffee while waiting for our dinner plans in Old San Juan... that the hotel kindly arranged for us. This was an overall a five star trip. I would highly recommend the Verdanza Hotel to any friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “40 minute wait at check-in, hotel is very crowded”
Reviews.Author: mons14
Reviews.Content: Just arrived and we waited for a good 40 minutes before we could be checked in. The lobby was also very hot, the AC seemed to be set to a high temperature. The pool area is very crowded, as they were giving out wristbands for registered guests, yet there are no empty chairs left. Room phone is also not working...hopefully that'll be fixed soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, and would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_8787
Reviews.Content: We traveled to PR for the first time and weren't sure what to expect from this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised! We had a great overall time and I would stay here again if we return to the San Juan area. We got a good price and I felt that we got our money's worth. I'd say the biggest positive was the friendliness of the staff. They truly made our trip enjoyable. Every person we interacted with was so nice, funny, and helpful; people went above and beyond in making sure our needs were met, helping us plan excursions, giving us advice, and just making sure we had fun. We received lots of recommendations for things to do, as well as advice on where to go and where not to go (for shopping, eating, beaches, etc.) We traveled as a group of young people, but we also saw lots of families, as well as couples; the atmosphere is appropriate and fun for pretty much anyone. The pool area had a little water park for the kids, and they serve drinks around the pool as well. Pros: Beautiful beach (the public beach is right there and is really really nice) Amazing staff - helpful, polite, fun, and friendly Great food in all of the restaurants Great bartenders Family-friendly Nice pool area Great activities desk with info on so many different attractions and excursions Did I mention that the staff was awesome?? We absolutely loved everyone there. :) Cons: Small bathroom and average room size (not that big of a con for us). Hotel isn't beachfront - it's across the street. This isn't a problem and it only takes a minute to walk there, but it's a busy street so I wouldn't let your kids go alone. We really didn't mind though. Restaurants can be pricy - though there are inexpensive options on all of the menus, too. The taxi to Old San Juan is $19; we just spent a day there though and it was enough time, so this wasn't all that bad. Not a whole lot of nightlife within short walking distance, though there's a lot that's just a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Gio10_10
Reviews.Content: The good: Everyone is very friendly, beach is a two block walk, Coladas restaurant will treat you like family, easy access to airport. The not so good: The bedsheet was stained, the coffee pot area was dirty, the bathtub was plugged, and the airvents were dirty. Also, the shower is a little small. It looks like they recently renovated the hotel. Some aspects of the hotel are very beautiful, especially the furniture, the color scheme, the lobby, and the very modern restaurants. However, it looks like they decided to skip certain necessities. (Note to general manager: Please schedule a cleaning of the air ducts asap) Overall, a nice stay. Would stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alovesj37
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stood here and i thought this hotel was absolutely fantastic. The location was perfect the people were friendly and the service and food was fantastic. I recommend this hotel for both leisure as well as business. Thumbs up!. The sprinklers were really cool too

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay. Roads are torn up, but staff very helpful - spoke Good English!”
Reviews.Author: dtkrabbe
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay after we got off the cruise ship and before we flew home. This place was great! Very helpful staff supplied written directions and costs for taking bus and ferry to Bacardi factory. Was also able to print boarding passes for plane home via the hotel's computer in the business/conference center - small room in the Fitness Center. Did not eat dinner here but was able to walk to nearby restaurant (Outback - my husband wanted a taste of home after the cruise). Later went to Coladas (in hotel bar) for drinks as we sat outside and talked about our vacation. Waiter was very nice and owner was very friendly. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cterri
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a one-night stopover on the way home from a cruise. Very clean, awesome bed...so comfortable! Nice pool too. 2 minute walk to a very long, very lively beautiful beach. Close to busstop for easy access to Old San Juan for 75 cents...A5 drops your right off at the bus station downtown old San Juan. Take a cab home if it's after dark though. Verdanza is only a 10 minute cab ride to the airport too. Will definitely stay here again and recommend it to any of my clients. Very kind staff too. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: melgt2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago when it was the Holiday Inn San Juan and I know they are under new management but most of the upgrades look cosmetic so I thought I'd submit a review anyway. When were first arrived we were pleasantly surprised at how sleek and modern the lobby looked since were weren't expecting much since it wasn't one of the bigger named hotels in the area. We did check out a few other hotels during our stay like the San Juan Hotel and Casino and the Water and Beach Club to party but you can't beat this hotel for the price and location. It was in walking distance to these hot spots and many more. There were local bars and restaurants mere blocks from the club and fast food restaurants if you are afraid to try to the local fare (which I don't recommend). And it is literally two short blocks from a beautiful beach so don't let the "not on the beach" location scare you. The staff were very nice and friendly and immediately let me and my friend know all the hot spots to go to during our stay. The Coladas restaurant is the best in town. With the nicest staff and the yummiest food, even with all the other places in the area me and my girlfriend ate here often. The bartendars are the sweetest and will make you specialty drinks upon request, just tell them the type of drinks you like. There are other restaurants here too but we loved Coladas so much we didn't try the others. The hotel's pool was great and relaxing, which we went to each day after the beach. The only downside was the business center computers didn't work and never got up and running on our trip but I'm sure they have fixed this by now. As for your trip I also recommend going to Old San Juan, we took a cab there but the bus back and the trip wasn't too far. It is absolutely beautiful there (especially at night fall), with the shops and hills, and quaint restaurants. It is a must do, we stayed for the day but you may want to devote two days because there is so much to do there. And visit the Bacardi factory for a fun tour and free drinks!! All in all great trip and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: nachos87
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the cheapest I could find near San Juan. I had very low expectations because the price was so low yet it had a great location, right near the airport (but not too close) and literally two blocks from the beach! It's also a block from the bus stop that takes you right into Old San Juan which was great. Let me just say I was totally blown away. The room was very clean, large, and the view of the pool was gorgeous. The bathroom was pretty clean, not spotless but honestly it was fine for me. The bed was SO comfortable! I tend to wake up a lot during the night, and I slept soundly through the entire night at the Verdanza. The pool was gorgeous, clean, and the restaurants in the hotel are amazing. I think that it would be nice if there was a slightly cheaper restaurant as most of the entrees ran from about $15-20, but it didn't bother me too much because there are lots of cheap restaurants right nearby. All of the staff were eager to help and very friendly. Even when I checked out, they were happy to keep my bag behind the desk and even had a ticket system to make sure you got your luggage from them. I think my -only- complaint is that you can really hear the water in the pipes in the rooms, but it didn't keep me up at night or really bother me too much.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemacwinnipeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed there twice on teh way to and from the British Virgin Islands where we chartered a sail boat. We found the rooms clean and the service excellent. We had a pool side room and really enjoyed being able to go back and forth. If you stay there I recoment trying the Outback restaurant that is in the hotel just down the street. It is alot cheaper than the ones in Verdanza. We would love to go back ! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad...”
Reviews.Author: chicagotoots
Reviews.Content: One block from beach, easy walking distance to the San Juan Casino, Intercontinental Hotel Casino, many fast food restaurants, and bus line to get to/from Old San Juan. Rooms and swimming pool clean, hot tub temperature was variable - some days too cool to be called a "hot" tub, another day it was too hot, shortage of pool towels for hous on a hot Saturday afternoon. Restaurant and bar in hotel, prices reasonable, food good. The service of the front desk staff was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “So good I have to review it!”
Reviews.Author: heatherNy
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old son and I were bumped off a Delta flight and given a free night at this hotel. Check-in was wonderful (thank you Michele!) and our stay went from good to better. The location is phenomenal, so near the Isla Verde beach, and the real atmosphere of San Juan. Hotel staff was unusually helpful on different issues. Pool is ok, not top quality but refreshing. We ate at the Hotel 80 casual bar, terrific food for myself and my son. An air of friendliness and genuine interest in the guests prevail throughout the hotel. I was sorry to leave and would love to return there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: sunfun051
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here many times when it was Holiday Inn, this is my first time in PR and his first exp with Verdanza. He stated there really are not too many changes. We both thoroughly enjoyed. Only issues I would say is the keys to the room require many swipes, there were always people sleeping with their luggage in lobby, they need to address this (possible cruise ship workers). Listed some places as 4star ammenities I would not say that. Convenient, clean, very friendly, restaurants/bars good, pool very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A+ + +”
Reviews.Author: LcdaGonzalez
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel when I was in a business trip. Even before I got there it was good. I called for directions and the person who attended me stayed with me on the phone making sure I didnâ€™t get lost. At 12:00 am I needed to print something and the front desk person made the arrangements to open the office for me, even though it was closed. On another trip I realized that I left my tooth brush and paste and an employee provided one for me. The only thing that wasnâ€™t that good was the night shift waiter at the restaurant. Not that friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottingMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Verdanza last night and have to say it was a very good place. We checked in very early in the morning after getting off a cruise. Although it was too early to get our room, they checked us in and took our bags so we could go into Old San Juan for the day. The bus (53C is best, or else A5) into OSJ is literally a block away from the hotel. There are lots of other hotels in the area, so lots of restaurants and also fast food joints. Also a 24 hour supermarket and gas stations. We had a room overlooking the pool in their "second building" (we didn't know it when booking, but their main hotel building is connected to another building that you have to cross an outdoor roof level sidewalk to get to...not covered, which wouldn't be good in rain, but it was fine for us since the skies were clear). Room was nice--you could tell it was old and just had a fresh coat of paint, but it was nice and didn't smell like an old musty place, carpet didn't look like it'd been vacuumed well, but 4 poster bed was great. Bathroom looked and felt a bit dated and very dark (only one tiny overhead light) and the electrical outlet in the bathroom didn't work, which was a pain because that was the only outlet close to a mirror. Mattress was a dream! Soft, cushy and comfy, it was the perfect night's sleep!! Staff was very friendly and courteous. No noise from airport or any parties at all. Ate in the Chinese bistro in the hotel for dinner and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of noise from restaurant”
Reviews.Author: loudizzle
Reviews.Content: For the most part the Verdanza is a decent hotel, although not in the same class as some of the larger Carolina hotels. I'm sitting here writing this review from my room in the hotel. I need to sleep and I can't because there is so much noise from the restaurant, which is 5 floors down! The manager on duty came came up to my room, heard the noise, agreed with me and said there was nothing he could do because the hotel was full. He was nice, but he really couldn't offer any significant help to me. If you stay in this hotel, do not stay in any rooms above that restaurant. Actually, if you value sleep and you don't want to take the risk of not sleeping, then you probably shouldn't stay here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nebeluna
Reviews.Content: At the end of this past January, I visited Puerto Rico with my sister. we stayedAt the end of this past January, I visited Puerto Rico with my sister. We stayed at the Verdanza Hotel, Isla Verde. On our arrival, we were cheerfully greeted by the hotelâ€™s doorman where doors were opened for us. While this is a minor detail, it signaled the type of personal attention that we would be extended for our entire stay. The reception and lobby areas of the hotel are beautiful. The accommodations are quite cozy, spectacularly kept with beds sinfully comfortable. We dined at 3 restaurants at the hotel. J.H. Leeâ€™s was a culinary delight. The Eighty Bistro was great and lastly at Coladas where we had a phenomenal meal of true Puerto Rican cuisine. On Wednesdays the Verdanza has a complimentary cocktail hour where the guests can meet and socialite with each other along with the hotelâ€™s helpful and friendly staff. To sum it all up, our stay was spectacular! Weâ€™re so grateful to the Verdanzaâ€™s management and staff for having provided us with such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach getaway from the frigid, snowy mainland”
Reviews.Author: ScottDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked a last-minute vacation for four nights here, and it was well worth it. The Isla Verde location is great -- two blocks from the beach (they also offer a pedicab service), and within a 5-15 minute walk to many restaurants and 5 minutes from a supermarket. You can take the A5 bus to Old San Juan for 75 cents. The hotel itself is well renovated and the service standards are high. My room was great, and any problems were fixed promptly: A poorly upholstered chair was replaced, a nonworking light bulb was replaced, and a worker showed the wall switch needed to turn on the outlet for the coffee maker (this could have been better marked in the room). I had a room on the third floor, which has balconies, so it was great to go outside and sip coffee each morning in the sun. It's close to the airport, but my room was well insulated and I didn't hear much plane noise. The front desk gave me a business card for a massage therapist who came to my room. My quibbles are minor -- one worker misinformed me of the bus schedule, and the gift shop's hours seemed to be erratic. I only ate at a hotel restaurant once (8020), but the meal (breakfast crepes) was great and the decor, well, space-age. David's Cookies was good for snacks -- they also carry breakfast items and ice cream. The pool area was clean and well-stocked with towels (needed for the chairs, many of which had bird goo). There's a tour counter and Dollar rental car business on site, though I didn't use them. In any case, I would highly recommend the Verdanza.

Reviews.Title: “VERDANZA HOTEL - OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: holidayinnfan
Reviews.Content: In February 2007, my brothers and I stayed at this hotel when it was named "Holiday Inn San Juan". You can see my review titled "A Gem of a Hotel in Isla Verde". Since then, we have stayed at the hotel three more times; February 2008, December 2008, and most recently December 2009. This review is for our December 23, 2009 - January 1, 2010 stay.
