Effective December 4, 2009, the Holiday Inn San Juan was re-christened "Verdanza San Juan", a memeber of SUMMIT Hotels. Having stayed at this hotel three times prior to our latest stay, we were interested to see the impact of thei move from Holiday Inn to Summit. I can happily report that we were very pleased. Our check-in was quick, efficient, and friendly. The doormen at the front of the hotel always open the doors for all guests and visitors at all times of the day, giving a warm and welcoming feeling.Upon arriving at the reception area, we were provided with complimentary towelettes to freshen-up as well as frozen ices in multiple flavors - - a cool and refreshing treat! The furniture through the lobby and common areas was all new and ultra-modern. The configuration added to the ambiance and intimacy of this very 'boutique' type hotel.The bellman immediately brought our bags to our room, a junior suite. The freshly painted room was nicely appointed, with new night-tables and a new dresser.There is a pillow menu to accommodate the most discriminating traveler. We were advised that new flat screen-tvs, bed-coverings, and draperies had already been ordered and would be arriving very shortly but in all candor the current fixtures were in excellent condition and we could hardly believe that they were being replaced! As the entire hotel (with the exceptionof the outside) is a non-smoking environment, there was no smell of smoke or must. The beds were immaculate and the linens were changed every-day. There was a large desk held the telephone, two complimentary bottles of water, and an ice-bucket. The free high-speed internet access which was most helpful since we all brought our lap-tops to stay in-touch with work (even though we were on vacation). There is also free wi-fi through-out the common areas of the hotel (the lobby, by the pool). The climate control/air-conditioning was excellent. The bathrooms were also well appointed, with plently of lighting, a great lighted 'shaving mirror', lots of thick, fluffy. large bath-towels, face-towels, and wash-cloths. Of course, complimentary soaps, body-lotions, shower caps, and shampoos were provided. Each room is also equipped with a safe, fridge, and iron & ironing board. Soda and ice-machines are located on different floors. The buffet breakfasts at Bistro 80/20 were delicious and offered an extensive variety of food including eggs, home-fries, danish, bagels, fresh fruit, sausage/bacon, quiche, hot and cold cereal, fresh squeezed orange juice, hot coffee - - I am sure that I have left a few things out. In additon to the buffet, guests could also order 'a la carte'.The waite staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel provides large towels (complimentary) for guests who chose to use the pool as well as beach-goers.rWe are strict beach-goers and one of the best beaches in the San Juan area is only a short-walk away. Although the hotel now provides their guests with a complimentary bike-shuttle to the beach, we opted for the short walk to help burn off the breakfasts! Although we ate there on previous visits, we can highly recommend Coladas restaurant and J.H. Yee's asian restaurant, both in the hotel. Of course, David's Cookies is a great stop for those with a sweet-tooth who want to grab that extra something before bed.While we were there, the hotel was very festive, decorated with all of the holiday fare one would expect. As part of their new image, the hotel features local musicians and the works of local artisians and craftspeople. The trio in the lobby included a singer/guitar player, trumpeter, and key-person that added a great latin-flare to the evening. In addition to going to the beach right down the block from the hotel, we also rented a car (Thrifty Car Rental is great!) and drove to Luquillo Beach as well as a public beach(some 2 and 1/2 hour drive each way) in Rincon. Of course, the trip to El Yunque was a must! We ususally stayed close to the hotel for dinner (Mi Casita and The Asian Station in a local strip mall one block away from the hotel are highly recommended) but we also ventured into Viejo San Juan for dinner at The Parrot Club on Fortuleza Street. The place is 'red-hot' and the food was outstanding but be prepared to wait because the kitchen staff simply can not keep up. The Mahi-Mahi (Pescado Dorado) was great as well as the Tres Leches chocolate cake for desert. When it was time to depart, the check-out was just as easy and efficient. A special 'shout-out' to Mariela Cintron at the front desk for her warm and friendly manner. In closing, we'll definitely be returning to the Verdanza San Juan in December 2010. It's our 'home away from home' and a truly special place where all guests are made to feel like family.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: apriltraveler12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Juan for a mini vacation after Christmas. I booked this hotel months before our trip, when the hotel was still a Holiday Inn. I was not pleased that the hotel had changed ownership but the Verdanza website looked great so we did not change our reservation. Pros: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The on-site restaurants were very good. $12 buffet breakfast was basic but did include hot and cold choices. The Asian restaurant had great food (dinner for 2 - $45). The beach is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The pool area was also very nice, clean large pool and plenty of chairs. Cons: The room was run down and felt dirty. The carpet was terrible, as was the bathtub/shower. Ceiling tiles were moldy and falling down in the sink area. Mini fridge was old and did not keep our drinks very cold at all (there was no knob to adjust the temp). My main complaint was that the room did not have many of the amenities listed on the webpage: updated furnishings - no, LCD TV - no, IPod docking station -no, free Wi-Fi - no. In short I felt let down because the website specifically lists amenities that we did not have. We did not spend much time in the room so I did not complain to the staff but in hindsight really wish I had! The area surrounding the hotel is very urban however there are very few other restaurants or shops.

Reviews.Author: MyAdvice
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here for one night in June and November 2009. In June everything was fine. Nothing special, but they were in the process of remodeling. I mistakenly assumed that they were fixing the property up to the new standards that Holiday Inn imposed on their chains, which are pretty decent. So I booked another night in November. Iâ€™m sad to report that the remodeling was now complete, but completely unnoticeable. Upon inquiry, I also found out that the hotel was leaving the Holiday Inn chain to become the Verdanza Hotel the first week in December. As a Holiday Inn brought up to the new standards, I would consider staying here for again. As an independent property that does not even meet the minimum standards that Holiday Inn has set, it is now off my lists of places to consider. BTW Internet in the rooms is wired, so if you do decide to stay here be sure to bring a cable with you or be prepared to hang out a lot in the public areas for the wifi.
